Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: cabecabe
Reviews.Content: The Bedford was great – I stayed for two nights on a recent business trip and it was one of the smoothest trips to New York I’ve had, largely because of the Bedford. In general a midtown location is fairly convenient, but much of the convenience came from its being on 40th street, just one block from the buses that stop just south of Grand Central and run to all three major airports. Being able to walk one block and catch a bus to Newark for $16 was a revelation. The room was surprisingly spacious – I had paid for a small room, but was upgraded to a “Tower Suite” which was essentially a one-bedroom apartment. The bed was a bit hard, but other than that the room was great. Street noise was a bit audible (room was on the fourth floor) but this was not a problem for me. Finally, the hotel staff was especially friendly, which made each walk through the lobby an unexpected treat. Highly recommended, especially if an airport bus is in your plans.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cally12
Reviews.Content: It was a lovely hotel, with very friendly/helpful staff who had good knowledge of New York. Location was perfect for central New York and 5mins from Grand central Station. The room was clean and good size with air con. Kitchen appliances were available to cook in your room. Only negative comment would be take ear plugs as old style windows so the noise of New York can disturb when sleeping! Would definitely stay there again :o)

Reviews.Title: “accomodations for 4 separate travelers”
Reviews.Author: alicnwunderland
Reviews.Content: 4 adults booked the Bedford for a two night trip to the city, 1 bedroom with 2 full size beds and livingroom with 2 pull outs, kitchenette (didn't use) and great nightime view of Empire State building. We were just blocks from Grand Central and easy walking distance to points of interest. The hotel and room were clean, basically furnished, moderately comfortable beds and hospitable staff. For 50.00 a night each this was great, absolutely no complaints, wear earplugs if noise bothers you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but needs better sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: The Bedford Hotel is situated in a great location just a couple of blocks from Grand Central. We recently stayed for a few nights, but had a lot of trouble sleeping because of a very noisy family living next door in the adjoining room. The doors slam very loudly when closed and shake the whole place up. The furniture and carpeting were pretty grungy, but not enough to make the place feel especially dirty. In summary, this is a pretty average hotel in a great location. If you're in New York to see the city, you won't have any complaints. If you're there to have a relaxing time in your room, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: GerryD609
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we consider in NYC- as a born New Yorker (upstate) and after 40 years of city visits. It is clean and inexpensive, but not grand. But it has, IMHO, the best location in the city, bar none. First, there is a every 15-minute shuttle bus (Olympia (downstairs, hard left to end of building and left out the door)) from Newark Liberty airport which has a stop (41st St., Lex and Park) one block from the Bedford. Two blocks away is Grand Central Terminal with all its connections and amenities, including a Times Square shuttle. Within a block are several restaurants (diner, Italian, Korean, Japanese, a Jewish delicatessan, street vendors). Within a block are an American Airlines office, a drug store, an Irish pub and a mini mart. It's two blocks from the Chrysler building and a 10-15-minute walk to the Empire State building. The staff is friendly and helpful; on one occasion, my wife left a pair of sentimentally-significant earrings in the room, which was returned to us. We think this speaks volumes about the Bedford. So, if you are in NYC for the city itself, not to lounge around the hotel, it's an unbeatable, inexpensive, perfectly acceptable by any one's standards, choice. If the Bedford is booked when we want to visit the city, we change the dates of our visit so we can stay there. Gerry and Kay Dobson, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: victor g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. Staff us rude and unhelpful. The hot water comes out a yellowish-brown! The staff said "oh, that happens. Sorry. Just let it run and it will clean up" I let it run for over an hour and it still didn't clean up. I gave this hotel a 1 only because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good price”
Reviews.Author: SabinaLaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week just before Christmas and got a fantastic deal. The room was large with two comfortable single beds as requested. Bathroom very nice with towels changed daily and soaps etc. replenished. One of the reasons we stayed here was because it had a kitchenette however this only consisted of two hotplates, one fry pan, a kettle to be used on the hotplate and a coffee maker. A microwave would have been a useful addition, given the lack of cooking equipment. There was enough crockery and cutlery. The room was serviced daily however it could have been vacuumed more often. Apart from that it was extremely clean and well maintained. Reception staff were very nice and welcoming. We got a special Christmas deal and saved hundreds of dollars for the week compared to the usual price - check before you book. The hotel was extremely convenient to Grand Central Station, shuttle buses to the airports (very good service), shops, restaurants, 24-hour deli etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price and staff”
Reviews.Author: DLRVancouver
Reviews.Content: Good location as many tourists sites are only a few blocks away. Yet, the neighborhood is very quite. The staff is friendly and efficient. I brought 2 problems to their attention one morning and both were fixed by the evening. They are also knowledgeable about local activities. It was great having a kitchenette in the room. The decor is a bit dated but kept clean. The lobby is small and gets crowded quickly as people leave their luggage to go out after checking out. The price was right for what is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SoulaB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is positioned on 40th street which gives you easy access to most of New York City. It is close to a metro station which makes it really easy to get around but is easy walking distance to Rockafella Centre, Times Square, Grand Central station and beautiful shopping on 5th Ave and Madison Ave. The bedroom, bathroom and living area was clean and comfortable. It was nice to have somewhere to make a cuppa (small kitchenette) after a hard day sightseeing. It was a little hot as there was no way to adjust the heating. The staff were helpful when we had questions but not overly friendly, just there to do a job. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: CampodeFiori2009
Reviews.Content: The pictures showed at the Bedford Hotel web site look way nicer than the hotel is. For NYC, the Bedford is not bad at all, just outdated and in need of a little touches to look better. The staff was nice and helpful. The lobby is very small, but who needs a big lobby in NY? You are going to be outside all the time anyways. I have got a double standard room which I found very spacious, clean and very comfortable beds! I was impressed with the good quality of the bath towels, shampoo and conditioner. Loved the location. Not busy but very close from Bryant Park (3 blocks). We walked everywhere; Times square, Rockefeller center, Broadway. There are coffee shops and a convenience store with salad and fruit buffet next to the hotel. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A suprising hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nea87
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to New York and decided to stay a little further away from times square. The hotel is set a block from grand central and park ave so close to all transport. I stayed in a suite on the 7th floor and even had a partial view of tje empire state building, which at night, was beautifully lit up. The room consisted of a small kitchenette, large bedroom, plus walk in wardrobe, and cupboard with safe. The main living room had 2 arm chairs, and sofa bed which was comfy enough to sleep on and always made up every day. The bathroom was clean and had a constant supply of towels, soap etc. It wasnt noisy at night at all. The staff were all friendly and helpful, reccomending resteraunts, and easiest routes to get to places. All in all, a great hotel, with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: EmanuelaDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two blocks from Grand Central Station, where you can have breakfast (I recommend Zaro), lunch and dinner, if you wish so. Our room was clean and comfortable (except we could not lower the heating system). Most of the rooms have a kitchen sink and stove, with tea/coffee facility, and our room had a view on the Empire State Building! The front desk staff was very helpful. Besides "Fagiolini", the restaurant next door, the hotel is also close to the good Italian "Padre Figlio" and the Turkish "Pera Mediterranean Brasserie", which is on Madison and 42nd.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of everything but no mad traffic at night!”
Reviews.Author: GERORP
Reviews.Content: A mixed family group (all adults) spent 4 nights in this really nice little hotel. I flew into JFK and got the Airtrain and Subway to Grand Central which is just around the corner from The Bedford. Our room was like a little apartment. One very large bedroom with a huge bed and an average size bathroom. A living room with two pull out double sofa beds which could accommodate 4 family members or very close friends. I slept on one of the sofa beds which was ok but was told that the double bed in bedroom was excellent. Behind folding doors there was a fridge, cooker (rings did not work though which did not bother us as we had no intention of cooking),electric coffee pot (kept the coffee hot) and a press full of crockery. A very large walk in closet with shelves and coat hooks. Very handy to keep all the shopping bags keeping the room clutter free. Also a safe. It's not your modern upmarket hotel but comfortable and very good value. It is very central and walking distance to Bryant Park and Time Sq. and many of the tourist attractions. All members of staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful and on the day we were leaving they held our bags all day. Would deff recommend this hotel for any group of friends or family visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyrotten1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my wife and 2 children ( 14 & 11 ). We booked a suite which has 2 pullout sofa beds in living area which is quite big. There was a large tv with plenty of channels. The bedroom had a nice bathroom off it. There is a kitchenette with 2 jobs, kettle, fridge etc There is a trouser press, iron and ironing board. One of the 2 closets had a huge digital safe. The is good wireless wifi in the room too I would have two minor negatives about the room 1. The decor is quite dated looking but the place was spotless 2. You have to walk through the bedroom to access the bathroom. It would be better if it had access of living area. The hotel is in a very central location, only 2 mins to grand central terminal. 10 mins to empire state building and Macy's. Less than 10 mins to time square. Within a few hundred meters there are plenty of diners for breakfast etc Overall a clean hotel with good facilities and very central

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ConnTraveller73
Reviews.Content: I booked my husband at the Bedford Hotel for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised by the low nightly rates. I came in to the city with my husband by train, and took his suitcase to the hotel, hoping they could store it there for me until check-in time. (it was only 9:00 am) I was meeting friends in the city, and didn't want to lug the suitcase around with me. What a surprise when they told me the room was all ready and I could check my husband in right then! The Porter took my bag and immediately took me up to the room. I had requested a higher floor, based on the suggestions of other reviewers, and they gave us a room on the 7th floor. It was so spacious, especially for a NYC hotel. It had a living room area, a little kitchenette and a big bedroom. The hotel is on the older side, but everything was clean, which is our top concern. I had trouble getting the key card to work, and they replaced it immediately. Later, I needed to call and cancel the last night on the reservation, and they did so in an extremely friendly manner. My husband ordered room service from the Italian restaurant adjacent to the hotel, and he said it was delicious. (I think he had spaghetti and sausage one night and pizza the next.) Overall, it was a refreshingly delightful experience. And it's proximity to Grand Central station, Bryant Park, and Times Square couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at good value”
Reviews.Author: MSSEast
Reviews.Content: Great location within easy walking distance of many key places in NYC - Empire State, Chrysler building, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, Macy's etc. Also quite quiet so easy to relax and sleep at night. The kitchenette was a great bonus but the electric rings took ages to heat a kettle - a must for a tea drinking Brit!! We didn't have a microwave in our room which would have been great as there was no way to heat anything up except a kettle as no pots provided. As others have said the rooms are a little tired and could do with a bit of updating but we found ours really comfortable and much more room than we were expecting. The room was also kept clean and tidy during our stay and we had fresh towels each day. We did stay in a suite and I'd definitely recommend upgrading to this as not too much more and great to have the space. Also our room had great view of the Empire State building which was an added bonus. For the value and location I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Gerry M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bedford Hotel for the first time last week and overall we had a great experince form the initial booling with Lydia right through the Check-in staff and porters. Hotel is ideally located and when cost was divided between five for a Suite it was definetly a bargain. One block from Grand Central made it so easy to commute all over NYC on Suway and buses to the all the airports. Will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing rooom”
Reviews.Author: Reasdia
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day break staying at the Bedford - first impression of the foyer/reception was positive, its a petty the rest of the hotel was not as impressive - the suite was inadequate for 4 adults. 1 twin room with ensuite bathroom which was shared by all persons and 2 sofa beds in the lounge area for the other two adult members of my party, these two beds had very thin matresses on which all springs could be felt through, when we asked for alternative rooms the male on reception was unhelpful - which totally upset the break. The toilet overflowed over the bathroom floor .. i wish i could recommend this hotel but unfortunately NOT....

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Idit M
Reviews.Content: Great location, most friendly staff, warm atmosphere in the small loby, the suite is very spacious and feels homy and it is relatively cheap. We come here every year on December and it never disappoints us. We will come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....shame about hotel..”
Reviews.Author: KirstM
Reviews.Content: The location was great next to the Grand Central, walking district to most central attractions, including Times Square, 5th Avenue, Central park etc. The welcome was great after a 7 hour flight, we did email the hotel for a upgrade as my husband booked it for my 40th birthday....but nothing! While reading reports on here before we went lots said that floor 3 was not the floor to be on, and yes we ended up on floor 3! Not great at all. The bathroom had been renovated and not finished, the bed was not the most comfortable, and needed a headboard, the cleaners should not have bothered to have come in after the first night apart from changing the towels. We always use the stairs as I am not great with lifts..lets hope that there isn't a fire and stuff stored in there and the health and safety people wouldn't be happy. The whole place is needs a refurbishment including the staff. Such a shame for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovations.”
Reviews.Author: Pedro0045
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs some renovations, to make it more lively - furniture, bed clothes, etc look old. One of the smallest bathrooms I have seen, plus I had the feeling that the bathtub was a bit dirty (ie when I opened the shower for the first time it flushed away some dust). But what really bothered me the most is the shower, all of a sudden there was this big stream of super hot water that made me jump out of it! Not pleasant. Good location, close to Chrysler building, grand central and NYC public library.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SchnetlersCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The Bedford Hotel is a really good, reasonably priced option in New York City. The rooms are neat and clean, and the staff very helpful. It is well-priced, particularly if you take their early bird special offer, (non-refundable) in a city where hotel accommodation can get ridiculously expensive. To top it all, the hotel is within walking distance from Grand Central Station, which is perfect for hopping on any line to take you to all areas of Manhattan. My room had a stunning view of the nearby Empire State building. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jenni W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it offered three beds. While the location was really good for walking to Times Square etc we would not book it again. It was old and the beds were super uncomfortable. Two single beds in one stuffy bedroom with the bathroom off that. The air conditioning was really noisy and didn't seem to make any difference. The beds apart from being really hard were noisy. Any movement made noise. In the end two of our party slept in the lounge area on the two pull out sofas which were more comfortable than the beds. The "kitchenette" was older and no pots despite having an element. No dishwashing liquid. The second morning we asked if there was another room we could try and they did swap us to an identical room. The beds were very slightly better but we would still not go back. The bed linen was tired and we had to ask for facecloths. The bathroom while small was nice and clean. At night the main door let light in around the door frame but we used it as a night light! The suite looked nothing like the pictures on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Roamer2007
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, renovated room, good size, clean. Microwave and fridge in the room, a bonus for a tea drinking Aussie. Free Wi Fi. Laundry service (pay by the lb.(kg).) and Deli close by. Located within easy walking distance to Grand Central station. Happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location to value can NOT be beat.”
Reviews.Author: Abled
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat, service top notch, decor a little dated, 1br suite is spaceous and decent price, deal with parking for $23.00 24 hr/overnight was a pleasant surprise. The price and location trump the minor flaws the space displayed. I came to walk around all day and night and travel on a budget, not sit in the room all day anyways. If this is your criteria as well this place can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DG40
Reviews.Content: We asked for high floor when booking and when we arrived we were given a great room (1505) with a balcony and a view of the Empire State Building which got my holiday off to a great start! We found the staff very friendly and polite including in the restaurant next door to the hotel. I guess the only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that maybe it needs double glazing as it's in the heart of New York City and the City really doesn't ever sleep hence night-time traffic noise! This hotel is in a great location with Grand Central Station just two blocks away, which of course then has links to the subway etc to take you to other parts of the city. We had a good American breakfast in Blooms, which is at the end of the block and would definitely recommend this but if you prefer to buy in your own breakfast there is a kitchenette area in the rooms (includes fridge, microwave, coffee machine, cutlery, crockery and sink). We'll definitely be recommending this hotel to my family and friends and if we ever return to New York we'll be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location makes up for cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: kengedahl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated two blocks from Grand Central station and just one block from the airport express. I got a standard room which was quite big for NYC. The king size bed was comfortable and the room was equipped with an old CRT television (not flatscreen as they state on there website but good reception and lots of channels), coffemaker, microwave and refrigerator. Wireless internet which worked quite well during my stay. In room safebox with space for my laptop, ironing board but no trouser press. The room was kind of worn down and especially the carpet was quite disgusting. When I arrived there was bread crumbs on the floor which was not removed during my stay. I do not think that there was must vacuuming in my room. Furthermore the carpet was nailed to the floor in front of the bathroom but the nails was not hammered all the way down which I discovered by walking over them barefooted. The bathroom was quite big but needed renovation e.g. a cracked sink. I stayed on the 7th floor and it was very quite. There are two elevators of which one is going to the basement and also functions as the staff elevator. There is a coin operated washing machine in the basement but I gave up on using it. It seemed that it was also used by the staff for washing hotel towels. In general the staff was friendly and helpfull and overall I was contempt with my stay and would consider staying there again but next time with a nice pair of slippers.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Lamps75
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights with friends in november as it offered the best value for us. The hotel is clean and the rooms are good sized, staff are friendly and very helpful, its an old style hotel but this is not a problem. The hotel is located about 200 yards from grand central station so you can get anywhere from there on the subway. We had 2 x one bed suites which were ideal as they had two twin beds and two sofa beds!! Basically this is an ideal hotel if you want a base to enjoy the delights of NYC. Would definately stay here if I travel to New York again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: CLT725
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect European-style hotel in a fantastic location for people who don't want to pay extra for bells and whistles. I asked for a very quiet room as I am a light sleeper and the staff were very helpful. We had a suite with lounge, bed, bath and kitchenette which was very comfortable and convenient, on the 14th floor with a view of the Empire State Building out the lounge window! Although not brand new or super-slick, the hotel has everything you need - clean, good bathroom, wi-fi, safe, good lifts, and there are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants nearby. The only down side was some aircon noise from the neighbouring building and one grumpy doorman, but overall we were extremely happy and comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: rh10mile
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights before a cruise. Excellent location, staff, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and suites a good size”
Reviews.Author: Ffiona W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located literally round the corner to the Grand Central Station and a couple of blocks from the Chrysler building. Easy walking distance to the Empire State Building too and not bad for Times Square. We found the staff helpful and friendly. They booked a taxi for the airport and we were able to add this to our bill. Taxi was roomy - much better than being squeezed into a NYC yellow cab as the journey is an hour. We had to check out at 11 but they looked after the cases for us and several other (ticket provided). The room we had was a suite (two rooms - one with twin beds the other with sofa bed - fine for our daughters) Two TVs, a kitchenette if you wanted to make breakfast but why would you with Blooms Deli on the corner. Our room had a view of the Empire State Building. Negatives were the wait for the noisy lift and a little gummy bear in the corner of the suite!

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: geoff d
Reviews.Content: Been travelling to USA every yr on hol for 19yrs usually driving all National Parks etc this was first time visiting New York, booked hotel thro' our travel agents stated was a 3*. Arrived about 6 in the evening went to desk to check in, no eye contact whatsoever from staff member, requested higher floor room answer (still no eye contact busy looking at computor) "hotel full your on the 3rd". Room was dreadful I have stayed in hundreds of American hotels and this has to be the worst ever, small, no headboard on bed, very basic and extremely dated. I appreciate that the hotels in New York tend to be smaller unless you pay megabucks although this was over Â£200 per night for that price we could have had a suite in the Bellagio in Las Vegas!. The staff were surly and non communicative we stayed 3 nights and never had a "good morning/afternoon/evening" from anyone. The GOOD points to the hotel were its location to the Grand Central St, Times Sq, Empire State Building all within easy walking distance. I have read some of the other reviews for this hotel where people have thought it was wonderful, large rooms etc so dont stay on the 3rd floor and dont expect the staff to be pleasant and you should be ok, Across from hotel is Pete Dillon's Irish Bar-fantastic place and turn rt out of hotel and rt again and eat at Scotties Diner, good food and excellent prices.

Reviews.Title: “large room near central station”
Reviews.Author: war47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just 2 blocks from the Central station and easy for subway access. The room consisted of a large lounge, large bedroom and coffee and tea making facilities. The size of the room surprised me considering the usual New York hotels. It was clean and comfortable. A bonus was the buses from the airport arrived a block away. Friends travelling with us were unable to stay at our hotel and had to stay at another hotel nearby at Â£300 more which was not worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: charliesangel67
Reviews.Content: Travelled as party of 4 females and had 1 bedroomed apartment which consisted of 2 beds in main bedroom (both doubles) and a double sofa bed in sitting area. There was a small "kitchen" type area which had a sink and a coffee maker, pots/pans and tea bags but we could find no kettle or cooker rings so ?why the pots and no kettle to make the tea. Room quality was average - there were bits left on the floor on the floor (hairbands) from previous guests and sofa was quite stained but we were literally just there to sleep in as left 1st thing in morning and only came back at bedtime so was adequate for our needs. 2 minutes walk from Grand Central statin and airport flyer bus leaves from the street around the corner. We arrived by limo as it was a friends birthday but took airport flyer back - $15. Bryant Park is nearby and nice to stop in for a drink on way back.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Oldbloke_TH
Reviews.Content: Arrived early evening to a small entrance/lobby front to the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Had large double bedroom with separate large lounge on the seventh floor. Opened what we thought was a walk-in wardrobe to find a kitchenette! Very useful. Did find a walk-in wardrobe with safe in the hall. Looked out the windows onto the backs of other hotels/apartment blocks and then realised that over the roofs we could see the Empire State Building from about floor 80 on up. Very central to lots of attractions and a quick stroll to Times Square. A couple of blocks to Grand Central Station, a stunning building. A few blocks south of Central Park. A very central location. We were very happy there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: g230
Reviews.Content: Great location just of Lexington. Small reception but staff great . Had room on 4th floor . Two single beds in bedroom with very nice bathroom. Two sofa beds in the large lounge with TV. Small Kitchen area with fridge, 2 rings and sink and coffee maker . Picked this hotel as I wanted 3 separate beds and this was one of the only hotels that could accommodate us. Itâ€™s furnished traditionally like most hotels in NY Hotel booked transport back to JFK and added it to our hotel bill which was great. I booked direct with hotel to make sure I got room I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and ok standard”
Reviews.Author: Martez
Reviews.Content: If you canÂ´t afford staying in Bryant Park Hotel (BPH) where our friends stayed, Bedford is a good choice. Compared to BPH you are a few hundred meters farther from "Center-Manhattan". But if you take a room facing the Park, you pay more than double at BPH. (And sorry to say, it worth the double.) On the whole the location for Bedford is both convenient and central. Just a few minutes to Grand Central and airport buses. And less than 10 minutes to Times Square. We had a so called "De-Luxe room". And as the rooms differ very much, my review is mostly limited to 508. Forget "De-Luxe". It is medium standard. But "De-luxe-size". Our room had two excellent and wide (140 cm) beds. On the firm side. (We canÂ´t stand soft matresses.) Wall-to-wall carpet. I love that. Two large and well-insulated windows. We liked the (but not very long) view to the backside.The same kind of rooms with a farther view is on 9th to 12th floor. But also farther from the street, in case of fire. Avoid the rooms with view to a wall 2 meters away. We had an up-to-date pentry. Spacy and modern bathroom. Most of the staff is very nice and informative. You have Starbucks 50 meters away. And a lot of similar places in 200 meters. Also restaurants. On the negative side: The AC was noisy, but not very effective. And if you sleep with open window, thereÂ´s noise from outside ventilation machines. There was a wide opening under the door. No problem for us. We put a quilt to avoid noise from the elevator, people etc. One of the doormen, with a constant stone-face, was of the kind you donÂ´t like to meet in a dark alley. The shower had no hand-held possibilty. The TV was built in the previous millenium. But good size. The cleaning was far below acceptable our first days. (For instance a half cookie, left from a former guest, beside a bed, stayed there for three days.) But more than perfect cleaning the rest of our stay. Would I stay here again? Very probable. Only If I find a room near to Central Park, of the same standard and price, I would change. (I like a morning-jogg.) But that possibilty seems almost impossible. As an alternative, I would also recommend a stay near Washington Square. Not spot center, but close to many nice parts of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Booked by our agent as 'suite' for four people. Even concierge was surprised when we were given 1 key for our party of 4. First room had one bedroom with two single beds, and two single sofa beds in the lounge. Room was filthy and the mattresses (if you could call them that) were about 2" thick with no stuffing and springs sticking out. Complained and was moved to another room. This time 1 bedroom again but with a double bed and a double sofa bed in the lounge, same type of mattress though. Was extremely uncomfortable, gave excruciating pain in back and ended up trying to sleep on the floor (on our own towels) as the floor was filthy as were the sofas. Nothing in the kitchenette worked. Only provided with 2 towels for 4 of us, bathroom was grimy too, every day we had to ask again for enough towels. Complained again about the standard of sofa bed we were supposed to sleep on and when we returned the next night, hey presto we had two knackered mattresses piled on top of each other. Another night on the floor. On the third morning after two nights without any sleep, 2 full days walking round the city and excruciating backache we finally lost our temper with desk staff who really could not care less and basically told us 'tough'. On our return that evening we had actually been given a proper mattress (naturally piled on top of the previous ones) This was not great but at least enabled us to get a few hours sleep. Everything about this hotel is shoddy, from the cheap bedclothes, dirty, stained comforters, filthy sofas, dirty bathroom. Housekeeping was a joke, nothing was cleaned, nothing replaced in the rooms, desk staff thought it was amusing. This place should be shut down, taking money from decent people for these rooms is criminal. The floor in Grand Central would be more comfortable and cleaner than this hole.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 165sng
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for Grand Central Station which has access to ALL areas of NYC by Tube/train. Lovely Clean hotel. Great ensuite rooms. Night Porter. We had a room on the 17th floor which had its own kitchen area within the bedroom should we wish to cook (which we didnt), but was ideal for coffee/toast making. Next door was an Italian restaurant which appeared to be linked to the hotel (very nice). Also round the corner was a lovely breakfast diner. Once we'd eaten there we didnt need anything other than maybe a coffee & cake until evening! Hotel was Ideally located & within 5 minutes walking distance, near the coach drop-off from Newark airport, which saved on Taxi fares! Tip: its worth queuing in Times Square at the ticket booth for the cut price tickets for that nights performances (usually about half hours wait).

Reviews.Title: “A little bit old, but with an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Tiagones
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no fancy rooms and the furniture is quite old, but the location and the price were reasonable. Well, our room had a view of the Empire State but the carpet and the bed sheets were of a cheap quality and the elevator was quite slow. Having in mind that we were there to visit the city and not the hotel, it was a good cost/benefit choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Viscount812
Reviews.Content: One thing I have found booking through Trailfinders is that they will always find you a hotel centrally located, which saves both time and money during your stay. The Bedford is one such hotel. An unprententious entrance and small lobby comprising of a reception desk, small seating area, and two lifts. Described as boutique, our room on the 10th was slightly faded from its' best, but warm, comfortable and adequate if not luxurious. The kitchen area was limited and the electric rings lethargic in operation - so slow we used the coffee machine when we wanted hot water for a drink. Apart from that there were two TVs, copious hot water with choice of bath or shower, a 6' wide bed which creaked but was comfortable, and controllable airconditioning units. The hotel has no restaurant as such, but Blooms on the corner of Lexington (30 seconds from the front door) has an excellent choice of full breakfasts for $10-12 including OJ and Coffee. Location of this hotel is simply superb. The Airport Express bus to Grand Central sets down within 100 yards of the front door ($15.50 single to JFK, $27 return). Subway are buses are as close, and 42nd Street is 2 minutes away. The Chrysler Building is on teh next block in Lexington, and you can walk to the Empire State in 15 minutes (you can see it from the back of the hotel). Having access to Subway lines 4,5,6 at Grand Central, together with cross line 7, means that you can be anywhere in Manhatten in around half an hour - fantastic! Staff are really helpful and although they were full and could not gives us a late late checkout on the day we were leaving (with a 10.30pm flight) they were only too happy to let us hang onto our room until 2pm free of charge so we could return and grab a lunchtime shower and change of clothes. I guess this is something of a phobia, but the only thing that worried me a little about is that the floor area is small, and it spreads up over 17 floors with around 8-10 rooms per floor with a lift and stair shaft down the middle. In an old building such as this, I am always happier if there is more than one way down in the event of a fire, or there is an external fire escape route evident. However all rooms were fitted with sprinkler systems!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LondonSaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located approximately five minute walk from grand central station. The location was amazing. The lobby was small but adequate. The check in staff were extremely helpful. Our bedroom was quite large with a beautiful view of the empire state building. The rooms were a little jaded but Â charmingly so and clean. Â As mentioned in previous reviews there is a little kitchenette with fridge, microwave and coffee percolator. Â The coffee was replenished daily.Â  Although there is no restaurant in the hotel, there are lots of eateries/restaurants nearby. We tried Scottys for breakfast one morning which was ok. Nothing special but did the job. there is a Chinese restaurant that does takeout called the Hunan manor which did really good food.Â  I would definitely return to the Bedford hotel.Â

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lots of space but a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: Heididisco
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2 night stay on Hotwire for $215 per night which to us was a bargain for Manhattan. The front of the building looks like a brownstone - very unassuming but pleasant.We literally walked the block and a half from Grand Central to the hotel which was extremely convenient for our travels around the city! We were allowed to check in early by a very friendly clerk and the concierge brought us to our room. There were two of us and we had a 2 room suite - two twin beds, and a separate room with 2 double couches that pulled out into beds (could have slept 6 total). The bathroom was clean and well sized for a Manhattan hotel. The towels were thick and fluffy. The sheets were clean. The furniture and rugs were a bit dated. The room came equipped with a small kitchenette and refrigerator which were dated as well, but for the price and the convenience of this hotel - who cares about the furniture? Would definitely return to this hotel and would definitely recommend it. The concierge let us check our bags on our last day since we checked out at 11 a.m. and didn't catch our flight until 5 p.m. That was a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Han2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and it was great. Fantastic location as one block from Grand Central with all its transport links. Also good for exploring on foot. Our room was a good size and had a fridge and microwave. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was a decent size and clean. Altogether a safe and clean hotel in a fantastic location. Good value for money and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ZitaL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband as part of our American Honeymoon... We'd been warned that NY hotel rooms usually aren't very big but we were pleasently surprised with Hotel Bedford. Our room was really spacious with two double beds and a kitchenette. Hotel location is fantastic, about 4-5 mins from Times Sq. Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. Would totally recommend this hotel, we both loved NY and will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “"GREAT,CLEAN AND SAFE HOTEL EXCELLENT LOCATION"”
Reviews.Author: tammy m
Reviews.Content: Location fabulous walkin distance 2 Time Square,Grand Central Station and Empire State Building.Very clean helpful staff always had a smile.WOULD DEFINITELY stay again had great view of Empire State Building from our window had an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and safe for a single traveller”
Reviews.Author: Bev15
Reviews.Content: The location was fabulous - walking distance from Grand Central Station and Times Square. It was reasonably priced, very clean and with a quaint appearance outside. The staff were lovely and very helpful. I would definitely stay there again on another trip to New York. Breakfast is not available, but there are many diners locally with a choice of breakfast options. The bus from the airport stops very close by and the fare is only $15.

Reviews.Title: “A good, convenient hotel, in E 40th St.”
Reviews.Author: AnnClarissa
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 week holiday in the US. I stayed my last four days with my husband and daughter in a suite at the Bedford. Our trip was organised by Trailfinders, and once again I cannot fault their taste. The Bedford was affordable and a suite gave us two rooms, with a large sofa-bed in the living room for my 17 yr old daughter. This large room contained a corner with a very small kitchenette (fridge, 2 electric rings and a small sink and cupboards above). The whole kitchenette was contained within cupboard doors so could be out of sight when not needed. There was enough cutlery, glassware and crockery to put together simple meals. The room also had a large TV and desk with chairs. Ample wardrobe space, safe and room for empty suitcases when unpacked. The main bedroom was of a good size - a queen bed (6ft) was firm but comfortable and the bathroom newly furbished, with good fittings, complimentary shower necessities and plenty of soft towels. Another TV in here. The location of the hotel was a 7 minute walk from Grand Central Station, and about 15 from Times Square. We were near a subway, but tended to walk or get the odd yellow cab. Plenty of cheap and not-so-cheap eateries nearby, also supermarkets and grocery shops. Starbucks was opposite the hotel, and a little diner, Blooms, was almost next door to the hotel for breakfasts. There are no restaurant facilities at all at the Bedford. Receptionists and porterage staff were friendly and helpful. We ordered a taxi on the morning we left to go to JFK, and the alarm call and booking were good. There were only two gripes. The first was the rather irritating rap music playing in reception when one entered from the lobby. The other was the order-in menu displayed in the bedroom. This was from a restaurant called Imperial. The food we ordered was inferior - chicken caesar salad, chicken strips, french fries - and the price we were quoted, 42 dollars, was a good 15 dollars more than we had worked it out before-hand. In other words, the menus are not kept up-to-date. We were told the new price when ordering through, and accepted it because we were hungry and had just driven up from Philadelphia, but be warned! Overall, a good stay, and we would stay again if staying in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not posh but perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kircody
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend and as it was significantly cheaper than the Hyatt at Grand Central where I had stayed previously, I decided to go with it. It certainly doesn't have the decor of the Hyatt but it was clean and comfortable. Our room was VERY big as hotel rooms go, with a little kitchenette and dining area and a balcony. It is perfectly situated for sight-seeing in New York, 3 minutes walk from Grand Central and within walking distance of the Empire State, Time Square, Macy's, 5th Avenue.....There is no restaurant attached to the hotel but we didn't find this any inconvenience. I would certainly recommend checking out the Bedford if heading to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but flawed”
Reviews.Author: DonnaH48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and was good value. Not the most up to date features and the kitchen area was, in fact, only really appropriate for take away food. However it was good value. The only problem was that I had tyo argue to get the room i booked. I was clear at booking that i needed a family room with 4 beds as i was travelling with my sister, niece and father. When I arrived i was given a room with one double bed and a double sofa bed. I had to really fight my corner as the hotel was very busy. I shouldn't need to insist that its inappropriate for me to share a double bed with my 80 year old father. In the event, though the hotel did come through, although my sister did have to share a bed with her daughter. Just be clear abut your booking and don't give in!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryMM
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Bedford in late May this year. The room was spacious and comfortable with lounge chairs, a desk and well equipped kitchenette and we appreciated the view from our windows on the 17th floor. Located a short and easy walk to 5th Avenue, the hotel is well located for visiting the attractions of this great city. Staff were attentive and a minor problem with a light in the walk-in wardrobe was attended to immediately. An added bonus was â€œFagioliniâ€�, an Italian restaurant downstairs and accessible from the foyer. The menu was small, but the food delicious, reasonably priced and the ambiance pleasant - a great place for dinner after a day of sightseeing. â€œBlooms Cafeâ€�, just a few paces from the hotel's entrance and situated on the corner of 40th and Lexington, is an excellent choice for a quick and hearty breakfast. Altogether a memorable stay at the Bedford.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, reasonably priced, no frills”
Reviews.Author: slowee08
Reviews.Content: It gets a 3.4 star. The hotel met and did not exceed my expectations. The staff provided friendly service, decently sized, simply apportioned rooms, no fancy lobby, no fancy decorations, working air conditioning (it got cold just like I like it), clean room, security, good location (three minutes from Grand Central), and was reasonably priced. There was a TV (not many channels...but who watches tv when in NY in excellent weather?), basic toiletries, clean towels, comfortable bed, no internet, no business center, no breakfast (plenty of offerings just a few steps away from $3 to $13). I would stay there again if I needed to be in midtown and didn't want to spend an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected pleasure”
Reviews.Author: GWVan
Reviews.Content: Realize that everything I say must be taked with a grain of salt because I started with a booking error elswhere and ended up with a free upgrade to a 15th floor suite. A big suite, 3 closets in a hotel room, are you kidding? That being said, the place was clean, staff friendly (in NY no less) and I have no complaints about my stay. If you find old fixtures and window air conditioners (2 in the suite - it was that big) this is the place for you, exceptional value in an expensive place. It's old and if that bothers you spend more money an a more modern cookie cutter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: wornout57
Reviews.Content: The Bedford is in the perfect spot to stay and take in the sights of Manhattan. Conveniently located less than 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. Clean, comfortable rooms with kitchenettes available and markets close by. Staff were friendly and helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our Christmas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HiHoSilver9
Reviews.Content: Centrally located by Grand Central, yet not very noisy. We had one of the tower suites, worked well for a family of 5. This hotel does not look impressive but is good value for NY.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience in US”
Reviews.Author: timverpool
Reviews.Content: I booked a Deluxe Studio Room and I was given Room 1010 which is the smallest room in the hotel. The hotel website stated the room provides a sitting area with a comfy armchair, a LCD/flatscreen TV. The room we stayed had none: a good size double bed with a chair and a desk, a 10 year old bulky tv. We had to sit on the bed. When I queried this with the hotel receptionist, I was given no answer. I paid extra for the little more comfort instead of the Standard Double Room but I was given the smallest room. We were very uncomfortable for 5 days there. The hotel is dated; everything is old and tacky. When I asked if I could have an invoice for our airport shuttle printed and I was prepared to pay for it, I was told they did not have printing facility. I was charged 2 lots of US$100 as deposit for 2 rooms for our family. When we left, I was only refunded one and I had to return to the hotel for the refund of the second deposit. I did not even get an apology from the female recepionist. I did not feel I was treated as a valued customer considering we paid a lot of money for the 5 of us staying there for 4 nights. I have praise for the housekeeping staff though. They are all very friendly and helpful. They did keep the room clean and tidy. My complaint is the management and the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sonya
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently stayed at the Bedford for a weekend shopping trip. The hotel itself is small but out room was a one-bedroom suite that provided plenty of room for the three of us. The suite overall showed its age but the bathroom had been renovated which was a nice update. However, there is no ventilation in the bathroom unless you count the window, which when you wanted to air the bathroom out, you would have to prop the window open. At this point, bugs would fly in the room. The service in the hotel was speedy and courteous. We were able to check in a little after 1pm. We really wanted to start our shopping venture so the bellman held our luggage until check-in. The only downsides were not under the hotels control. The discounted parking for the hotel was three blocks away and after 7pm, we had a really hard time catching a cab nearby. We ended up having to walk up to Grand Central to catch a cab which was another 3 blocks in the other direction. We ate at the Italian place in the lobby one night, the food was not good but the waiter was nice and we ended up grabbing something else later. All and all, we would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back !”
Reviews.Author: Marty077_11
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and I must say that Bedford Hotel was the perfect location !!! I stayed here for 8 night and came back for another 4 nights. Rooms were big compared to other hotels that I looked at and great value for money. Right near Grand Central Station and 15 mind walk to Times Square. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were cleaned with everything you need such as a mini kitchen. Would definately stay here again and highly recommended. Marty

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME value for NYC !!”
Reviews.Author: DHIIPAK
Reviews.Content: Always the choice for our money in NYC. LARGE rooms with kitchenettes, central location on 40th St. Friendly staff, etc-etc. Real nice homey vibe to property....if you want modern chain hotel chic & plushness go pay $400 / nite at the regular big names with their homogenized rooms, points, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia5641
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends in a Suite at the Bedford and we were very comfortable. We had two pull out beds in the living room and two twin beds in the bedroom. The management was very responsive to all of our needs. The location is great, and as three women, we felt very safe in the area.We walked all over the City from this location. Joan R.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Andy982
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and enjoyed the hotel. The room was big and the bed very comfortable, Its in a great location in a quiet ( by New York standards ) street. It has a friendly cosy atmosphere and after a long day visiting all the sights of New York it was nice to come back to. There is some great local bars and eateries close by and Grand Central station is just a couple of minutes walk away. Personally I thought the hotel was a bit overpriced for what it is, particularly compared to the prices we paid for similar hotels in other cities. I would definately recommend the hotel but maybe I would suggest shopping around to see what else you can get for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Central location, good clean rooms..”
Reviews.Author: Annie20951
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a school trip to New York and was pleasantly surprised! Having just come from an okay hotel in Washington, I was expecting this hotel to be similar: not great showers, creaky beds, etcetera. Given that we also knew the hotel must have been cheap (c'mon, it was a school trip after all!) this hotel was ridiculously good! The rooms were fairly large, as were the bathrooms. Everything was clean, the televisions worked, and the concierge had funny stories to tell. What's not to like? I seriously can't recommend it enough. We could see the Empire State Building from our bedroom window, and though the hotel doesn't have its own resteraunt, Starbucks was on the corner. My only complaint would be that there were only two lifts, and given that there were 70 of us on the trip.. You see the problem! Also, we were put in rooms all over the hotel, but we needed the biggest rooms so I guess that's just the way it goes! All in all, the NYC hotel could have ruined this trip for us, but it made it extra special!

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to everything”
Reviews.Author: elu22222
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service to/from Newark stops around the corner from hotel, and Grand Central Station is 2 blocks away. Great neighborhood restaurants, deli's, and coffee shops. Walk to everywhere! Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthsideEddie
Reviews.Content: The Bedford Hotel on East 40th Street and Lexington is located in a nice cental location and is an ideal base for shopping and theatre going expeditions. The hotel is somewhat old fashioned and lacks some of the amenities we have come to expect with more modern Hotel chains however because of its location and inexpensive prices I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dealpirates
Reviews.Content: Bedford hotel hints at a former grandeur that has slowly faded like it's decor, couch stains ruining presentation, needs update. As most new york hotels go the space is small but adequate. Service was good. Price reasonable for the location it provides, 2blocks from grand central station, 10 blocks from empire state bldg, 14 blocks from time square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: sharontania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December and loved it !! Perfect hotel in a perfect location. Small and welcoming and unbelievably peaceful for New York !! A fantastic diner for breakfast and a friendly Irish pub only a short walk away. We will definately be coming back to this hotel on our next visit to this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: goyaDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bedford Hotel a few years back so it's been a while! Not too long to remember NOT to stay here again. Smallest room I've ever stayed in and furniture and fittings outdated, I don't mean old-fashioned charm here, I mean in need of refubishment and not up to standard for the exorbitant price we paid. The ensuite bathroom was really like something out of an old gangster movie, shabby and again outdated. I've seen larger bars in private homes and during our five-night stay we couldn't have a drink there unless we stood up to have it. Foyer also very small and reception desk undermanned, always customers waiting inordinate lengths of time for service. Our safe didn't lock and we had to wait an hour and a half for en employee to come up and service it. The so-called in-room kitchenette was a hob in a cupboard which we discovered later did not work either. By this stage we weren't about to waste more time waiting to have it fixed; we hadn't crossed the Atlantic to wait in for tradesmen!! So we were without the facility to even make a cup of tea/coffee. This was our first time in an american city and this hotel let us all down. There are first-rate hotels in New York for half the price of this establishment where I have since stayed so my advice is - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Sigh....”
Reviews.Author: Highmaintenence123
Reviews.Content: Ok. This place shouldn't be called hotel... More like motel. Old building, outside traffic noise, no bed frames, elevator noises at night, you get the picture. I paid reasonable amount for three star hotel. Didn't get what I expected.(terrible pillows). Only good thing was location. Walked to Rockefeller center.

Reviews.Title: “Bedford Hotel NYC - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lainy9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bedford Hotel Manhattan New York City for 5 nights in April 2011. We were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel and friendliness of the staff. Each and everyone was polite and helpful and our room was really good with a tiny kitchenette (but this was enough and suited our needs). Transport was not problem as the hotel is near Grand Central Station and within walking distance of most attractions. Plenty of restaurtants etc within walking distance. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a budget type hotel in Manhattan. Stuart and Lainy South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Joann145
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bedford over the internet from Australia and crossed my fingers. Rarely do expectations meet the promises made. The Bedford was fantastic. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Really comfortable king-sized bed with the BEST pillows!! I stayed 10 nights and the room was always left clean and tidy for me. Can't recommend the hotel highly enough if you want somewhere mid-East Manhatten. It's close to some great bars and restaurants, and Central Station for the subway. Oh, and the room was huge!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adzi1989
Reviews.Content: The exterior and lobby of the Hotel are great and very nice, however the rooms are totally different. The bedrooms are basic and have seen better days. This hotel was just a place to sleep and it served it's purpose, however I would not have spent more time than necessary. There was peeling paint, creaky doors, worn carpets and furnishings, small bathrooms and hard beds. The sleep quality was quite poor as the hotel was extremely hot (it was 0c outside most of the time) so the air-con needed to be run 24/7 and the units are very noisy. Additionally the beds are incredibly hard and somewhat uncomfortable. Showers had good pressure and always hot-water. The staff are brilliant, always happy and smiling. A nice welcome when trudging in at midnight after a day of sight-seeing. Wi-fi was very temperamental and slow. The signal strength was quite poor given that there were routers on every floor. They provide washing facilities in the basement along with a vending machine. The basement is obviously not guest orientated as it feels like a perilous obstacle course! All in all, the hotel served it's purpose but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible hotel...not worth it”
Reviews.Author: jschmidt1
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I've stayed in and I've stayed in small places in Europe a lot. It is an old hotel that has seen better days. It clearly hasn't been updated in many years, with the exception of the bathroom. Everything about this hotel said old. The bed had no headboard. The windows were old and drafty. You could hear the street as if you were sitting in the trucks passing by. I could feel cold air breezing through the windows. I was there in early March and they didn't have the heat on. My room was very cold and I had no ability to control the temperature. Everything was old and beat up. The staff weren't firendly at all. I don't think anyone ever said: hello may I help you. The concierge basically only grunted. No one on staff that I met was pleasant. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fab city”
Reviews.Author: crazylady64
Reviews.Content: I was a little unsure about this hotel as there were differing reviews on various websites but I was pleasantly surprised. I travelled with my eldest daughter who had stayed at this hotel in 2007 when she came to New York on a school trip. I was expecting it to be rather dated from some of the reviews. We stayed for 3 nights(was to be 4 but the airline cancelled our flight and put us on one a day early, very nice of them we thought!) We found it to be clean, staff were helpful and pleasant. Our room was at the back of the hotel and didn't have a good outlook though we could see the empire State Building if we looked up but to be honest the view didn't matter and in a way it was quite good being at the back because we didn't experience as much noise as being in a room on the main road. New York is the city that doesn't sleep. It is a small hotel and doesn't have the attractions of some of the bigger hotels such as a spa, or swimming pool but that didn't matter because you don't travel to New York to swim! We did all the usual tours while we were there and our feet didn't touch the ground! The hotel is about 15 - 20 mins walk from Times Square which was okay. When i go back I will definitely g stay at this hotel again. It was cleaned every day we were there, staff helpful and a very nice pleasant 1st trip for me to the city that never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: Lauren2711
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2010 as part of a university trip, I would have to say that the location was good right around the corner from grand centeral station and an easy walk to other attractions in manhatten. I would recommened Scotty's dinner as its right around the corner and the hospitality was very good felt really welcome. What let this hotel down for me was after being up for 48 hours before we arrived I expect things to run smoothly, we arrived in our room and it was a good size plenty of room for the 4 of us we were about to head out but found that the safe didn't work, we rang down to the reception and got told someone would be up to fix it later, so we had to take our passports and all our money out with us. We returned later and nothing was fixed, we then headed down to reception the next morning found the staff rude and not very helpful, we told them again what happened got told someone would be up fix it later, so asked where are we suppose to leave passports and money got told we could leave it their little safes but then got to be told if we lost the key we would have to pay $100, I didn't appreciate the worry of trying to make sure we didn't lose that key and our safe didn't get fixed until wednesday bit pointless when we were leaving thursday at midday and another thing was that we had no control over the temperature in our room and it was constantly on hot and every time we turned the aircon on the room service would come in and switch it off, plus the wifi was awful especially when i wanted to e-mail home about my trip. I will not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jdog16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location- it was within walking distance to many NYC attractions but still in a quiet and peaceful area. There is a starbucks across the street, Scotty's Diner around the corner and close to NY public library (free internet). The kitchenette was useful to store fruit/groceries for the week and there is a supermarket a few blocks away on 3rd Ave. The room was a good size (standard room) however the heating system was all or nothing. Hotel also had washing machines and dryers in the basement which was handy to do laundry ($1 per use). At times, I found the staff to be a bit unhelpful and vague but overall, the hotel was good value and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,reasonably priced and fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: davwen145
Reviews.Content: We had booked hotel in Feb 2010 for a 10 day stay in December 2010. Room presented as per photos and my main request was met...view of Empire State Building! Reception staff were polite and helpful...we were more than happy with The Bedford....would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Moira3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bedford in December-arrived very late but we were met by a helpful receptionist and concierge.Rooms were upgraded - large lounge, a bit dated but very clean, staff were very friendly and helpful. We had searched for a hotel that was reasonably priced and were not disappointed-would stay there again and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasonap
Reviews.Content: We had a great stary at the Bedford form 4 nights. It's was clean, everything work the way it should, no bed bugs and its so close to so much ie: grand central station, empire state building, a pleasant walk to times square. Really looking forward to going back

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janandhol
Reviews.Content: The Bedford Hotel is a fantastic hotel, great location and great staff who always went the extra mile for me and my family especially when the "Big Storm" of Dec 10 came along and our travel plans were completely ruined. I would stay at this hotel again and I am already looking to book again for Dec 11 it was so good. If you go I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: katys862
Reviews.Content: I had trouble finding a hotel within our price range then I came across the Bedford. It is just a block or so away from Grand Central which is full of shops and food. The room was fairly large for what I was expecting to get in Midtown Manhattan. There were 4 twin beds, 2 in a bedroom and the couch folded out into two seperate beds. I would recommend you check about the beds before you book, if you are planning a romantic trip. (I do not know if all rooms are this way or if it was just ours). There was slight plumbing issues in our bathroom, but nothing we couldn't deal with. Kitchen was just a sink, small stove, and dorm size fridge. Worked for keeping some drinks cold for us. Overall I'd say it is an excellent hotel for the price. It is older and small but staff seemed very friendly and how much time do you really spend in the room anyways?

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: whitehart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights... paid $125 a night. Very clean but dated, staff friendly and room size good. Safety deposit box broke on 2nd day ( the maintenance is done by an outside company ) put valuables at front desk deposit box and had to use the whole stay as repair never done. Had a smoking room with no ashtray ...but hey for the price these are niggles. Easy to get around from Grand Central. Wasn't to impressed by Bloomers but loved Scottys round the corner. DO NOT eat at The Curry Pot (Thai) opposite Scottys. We made this mistake and were served RAW , not undercooked, chicken satays. In the 6 days we were there we never saw a soul in there ! Went to The River Cafe for my daughters 21st and had an excellent meal with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: GolferStockport
Reviews.Content: Located just five minutes walk from Grand Central Station, Bedford Hotel was a great location for our visit to New York City. The hotel was comfortable and clean and staff were welcoming and friendly.(request a room with a view!) We used the excellent Bloom's Del., close to the hotel, for breakfast on each of our four days in Manhattan and visited the River Cafe for an outstanding but expensive evening dine.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff and bellman were bad”
Reviews.Author: Fabio1009
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok very clean...the two woman at the front desk sucked big time had terrible attitudes (hated speaking to them) and the bellman was even worse I hated him even more (think his name was Andy..stay away from him) they made my stay very unpleasant...

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suerich086
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Bedford early afternoon and were shown straight to our room which was quite large by any standards. The staff were very helpful and friendly especially the conceriege. Hotel was warm 24hrs a day and rooms were cleaned daily very thoroughly. Lovely view from the window of the Empire State Building. Close toeverything and since this was a shopping trip several trips to the hotel to unload were necessary!! Would recommend this hotel to anyone and am already looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean & Reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: UlsterMartha
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay in the Bedford NY,had a Tower suite which was clean, spacious & well laid out. Staff are pleasant but not overly friendly.Both TVs were broken in our room,thanked for telling them but no apology given. Quiet rooms,would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: unojenga34
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bedford after reading reviews & thought it sounded like a good value hotel. Well we were really impressed, we booked a kIng size room & it was very big for New York. It had a kitchen area with fridge & a desk & large arm chair. The bathroom was big as well with a bath. Friends we met up with paid for a new modern 4 star hotel & said their room was tiny & only had a walk in shower! The building was lovely & had many traditional features & the staff were very friendly & helpful. We emailed before arrival to request a non smoking room & this was delivered. We would definetely stay here again as we could not believe how close we were to everything, 5 mins walk from Grand Central station & 15 mins walk from Times Square. Would also recommend Scotty's round the corner for breakfast. All in all this hotel made our trip to New York we could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a lovely neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: cranleigh58
Reviews.Content: Hi - have just returned from NYC - went there for a long weekend with my sister and three nieces. We have all been to NYC several times before and were all very impressed with the standard and location of the Bedford Hotel. Would highly recommend the Bedford Hotel and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY STAFF, VERY CLEAN HOTEL, RATES VERY REASONALBE, GREAT NEIGHBORHOOD AND CONVENIENT TO MANY ATTRACTIONS.”
Reviews.Author: Ginger051651
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed for several days at the Bedford Hotel which is located in the Turtle Bay area of Manhattan and is only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. The neighborhood is lovely and very safe. The room we had was spacious and very clean (I checked for bed bugs, a huge problems in NYC these days, and there none nor any evidence that there had been) and the bathroom is huge by NY standards. There were plenty of towels and they were nice towels, not the thin ones you usually get when not at a luxury hotel. We stayed in a room that also had a semi-kitchen: a coffee pot and stove top and fridge and sink but w/o a microwave which I wish they had had. There is also an ironing board and iron and an in-room safe. The staff was very welcoming and they allowed us to leave our luggage in the reception area after we had checked out without charging us for it (tips appreciated though!) The Bedford is a place I can recommend w/o any problem and will stay there again. It is a charming boutique hotel on the east side of town close to Lexington Ave. so you can catch the Lex. subway line or while at Grand Central catch or get to any subway line you want; or you can walk to the theatre district or to the UN, etc. Enjoyed our stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: staithes7
Reviews.Content: paid $200. per night to stay in a rabbit hutch size room,booked deluxe studio room with trailfinders,checked on internet back home appears we were put in a standard room,plus point it had been recentley decorated,stayed 3 nights,room not cleaned or made up on second day

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Book Ahead to get the best rate”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzyslippers64
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel probably 5 months in advance and got a really good rate. We've never been to NYC so didn't really know what is central. It turns out this hotel is just behind Grand Central Station, can't get better than that. In fact, when we got in, we got the Super Shuttle which drops you off literally 1 block away to the hotel. For $10/trip, it was way cheaper than a cab - and the kids were free! We got a family suite which has a one bedroom and a small kitchen. Didn't use the kitchen much except for the fridge and the coffee maker. We saved on breakfast by buying fresh bagels 1/2 block away and having our coffee in the room. We spent 5 days touring around all the major sites, which are all very close to the hotel, either by walking or by a short cab ride. We got a one day pass to the subway for one of the days and went downtown to see Ground Zero, and then hopped back slowly, stopping at every subway stop through Soho, Little Italy, etc. Otherwise, we just walked. It was a lot of fun. And the hotel was definitely a great deal, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: OhioBean
Reviews.Content: Considering the going rates for hotels in Manhattan, the Bedford is a value. Located a block and a half from Grand Central Sta, the location couldn't be better. We (two of us) were upgraded from a standard room to a suite, which meant a nice quite bedroom off the street. Bathroom clean and modern with tile and porcelin. Decor of "living" area outdated and a bit shabby, but for the price of $220, hard to beat in this location. Bed comfy, and the monster pillows on bed could be replaced with thinner ones kept in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MsBrownWarrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights pre cruise. The location is second to none. the airport bus from JFK drops you 5 minutes walk away so even with suitcases its easy. Grand Central is 5 minute walk and there are so many places there for a quick snack. We were on 9th floor, we had booked a kitchenette, but the room did not have one. We were given another room and this proved to be comfortable, very clean, loads of towels, hot water, toiletries, fridge, small two ring stove. Perfect. You could see the Chrysler building from the hotel. Bus stops on 3rd and 2nd avenue were very convenient for heading south.It was great to arrive back after a very busy day and put the kettle on . You cannot get away from the noise I'm afraid because its an old building and still has the old metal frame windows, not double glazing. But hey, you are in New York. Desk staff were ok. There were a lot of them and a friendly porter who always had a word. You can store your luggage before you leave which is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buffyk911
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I was worried as we had found it on line and were coming from CA to stay. It was a nice surprize to see how clean it was. The rooms were small, but it is NYC so what do you expect? The location was great, just 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. My only complaint while they knew there were 2 people staying in the room, they continued to only give us 1 washcloth each night !! Even when we asked for extra towels, the next day we were back to 1 washcloth.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Review... Rubbish..”
Reviews.Author: bako74
Reviews.Content: This was an great hotel. I was a little scared due to some of the mixed reviews I read. But I had a excellent time here. The rooms were large and clean. Everything was in walking distance. And my Wi fi worked perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kerry_manchester
Reviews.Content: Based on price I wasn't expecting much but overall I was pleased with our 1 bed suite and balcony. Yes the sitcom is noisy and you gave street noise but that's nothing ear plugs can't fix!!! This is traditional, friendly and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotspurs
Reviews.Content: We stayed att he Bedford for 5 nights in early September 2010 and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and standard aof the rooms. We had read about the hotel on Trip Advisor before we left and the reviews were mixed but our stay was nothing but good. Firstly the location for Midtwon and the attractions is perfect, literally 1 minute form Grand Central Station and also from the Newark Airport bus drop off/ pick up point means no dragging cases all round a strange city! It is 10 minutes walk form Times Square and has a good selection of restaurants within one block. The room was clean, a decent size and fairly modern in it's decor. If you are looking for an uber trendy boutique hotel this is not it, but if you want a clean, modern and central hotel then book now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jean831
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station, subway and Express buses to JFK and LGA. Lots of good places to eat nearby as well. Room is comfortable and clean, with microwave, refrig and coffee maker. Staff is very friendly and helpful. A great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people but rooms questionable”
Reviews.Author: margarethinchliff
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 6 nights. We had a studio room with a kitchenette. The facilities for cooking were not great. The stove didn't work nor did we have adequate cooking utensils, nor did the safe work. The carpet looked like it hadn't been vacumned.
