We were moved to another studio and again the stove didn't work, nor did the safe work and there were problems with the hot water at the kitchen sink. There was no stopper for the sink either. The carpet appeared to not have been vacumned. So the staff moved us again to another studio. Again the stove did not work properly so we were given a one burner cook top. We found evidence that the carpet hadn't been vacumned either. On a bright note we found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. I feel a maintenance check on each room after guests leave would be a good idea to ensure that appliances are working. The reason we chose this hotel was for the cooking facilities as my daughter has celeac.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but spacious room-- good for families”
Reviews.Author: Likes2GoGoGo
Reviews.Content: I wanted to put in a plug for this surprising little hotel. We arrived late. Front desk was friendly as was the bellman despite the hour. He took us up to our room and gave us the full show-around. We had reserved a one room suite and-- since it's New York-- were really surprised by the size of it. There was, in fact, an entire separate bedroom with its own TV. The bathroom was attached to that bedroom, so not the best convenience, but fine. The room was warm when we got there, but the bellman turned on the two a/c units and soon enough, it had cooled off. This is an old hotel with old decor-- thick layers of paint on the door, brass doorknobs and (attention Moms) a big old fashioned tub for soaking. The room was quiet as could be and it was clear they pay serious attention to sleep-- really good pillows, okay mattresses, blackout shades on the windows, plus drapes-- the room stayed as dark as the ones in New Orleans that are designed for people who stay out drinking all night. People who stay out drinking all night and six-year-olds who arrive on late flights need those dark quiet tomb-like rooms, so they get their rest. The room had a small kitchenette with mini-fridge, electric stovetop and coffee maker. Plus a cabinet with some dishes. There was a hallway to the living room with had two sofas, both pulled open to reveal a slightly larger than twin bed. The room looked out on a small courtyard of apartment building windows with a BIG TREE-- something you don't expect to see a couple blocks from Grand Central. Downsides: Warm room on arrival, somewhat dingy decor compared to upscale hotels, courtyard and fire escape look a little dicey to non-New York eyes, but I'm sure they're fine. Toilet is crammed against the wall (but I've seen that before in New York). Upsides: LOTS of space. Deep old tub. Kitchenette. Very very friendly staff. Spitting distance to Grand Central. Quiet. We're writing this one down as a standard option for New York trips and I'd highly recommend it to other families who aren't frightened off by an occasional dust bunny behind a radiator or a dated bedspread. If you're finicky, stay away. If you're in New York to see the city and want a little extra space for your family, this may be your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellant location”
Reviews.Author: JoJacksLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the Bedford. A great location so close to Grand Central, and all the transport links. There are also lots of food deli's around, to make eating out cheaper. The room itself was larger than I was expecting, and had I think been recently refurbished including the bathroom which was a plus. The kitchenette was a nice addition, so we could use the fridge for drinks etc..The A/C unit was a little noisy but nothing too bad. The reception staff were attentive when not checking their blackberry's but this seemed to be a very New York thing! Able to leave luggage after we had checked out until we left for the airport which was great. A good basic hotel in a good location. No extra frills, but then how much time would you actually spend in your hotel with all the sights to see?!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but nothing horrible either”
Reviews.Author: h1joly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and had a decent experience. Boutique hotels in NYC are a gamble, so we had pretty low expectations... and the hotel met them, sort of. We had a smooth check in (though the bellman had a major attitude--once he got his initial tip, he never said another word to us during our whole stay), and used the hotel mainly as a place to crash at night, so there's no "service" to really comment on. The front desk was friendly enough, so no complaints there. There is free wi-fi, which was a plus, and the safe was also free. The location is perfect--just two blocks from Grand Central and maybe a 15 minute walk to Times Square. On the website, there are photos of beautiful renovated rooms. We did not get one of those. Our room was tiny (as expected), sad and old. Yucky comforter, no decor, cracks in the ceiling, and all around just tired and drab. There were a lot of little annoying things about our stay, but nothing that warrants a real complaint. The walls are paper thin, so we could hear our neighbors, the TV had issues, there was no "all about your hotel" welcome book or anything (a basic one about NYC, yes, but nothing specifically about the hotel services available), stains on the carpet, and the window A/C unit that was blocked by the curtains. And there were just all around very few "extras." No coffee or mints in the lobby, no breakfast, no smiles, nothing that showed anyone there cared that we were staying there. The worst thing I can say about the hotel (and the reason I would possibly not go back) is that the bed was like a rock. I have NEVER slept in such a hard bed (and I barely slept in this one!) It was honestly like sleeping on the floor. Hopefully, the renovated rooms have new beds, because it was horrible. All in all, it wasn't terrible enough to say "I'll never go back!" but not good enough to say "It's the only place we'll stay in NYC!" If we get another good rate from the travel website, we'll probably stay there again. I'll just make sure to ask for one of the "newer" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Sub-Par "Suites"”
Reviews.Author: D-Girl313
Reviews.Content: Great staff, VERY VERY friendly and helpful. The rooms were not the best. The beds left me with aches every morning. The carpet wasn't the cleanest. The location was awesome. We were able to walk most places.

Reviews.Title: “great location & flexibility”
Reviews.Author: traveling_fr0m_TX
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bedford off and on since 2000; initially I was brought there on a school field trip, and have since brought other groups there and choose to stay there myself with friends. You really can't beat the location if you are visiting the city for a few days, because the proximity to Grand Central Station makes it so easy to get a train to just about anywhere in the city (not to mention a nice variety of breakfast / lunch options, coffee places, and people watching). The rooms have great flexibility for families and groups - suites can sleep four to six in various combinations of twin or double beds and fold outs. It's also nice to have a fridge, stove and microwave when in the city so you can save money on breakfasts and lunches. The building itself is beautiful, and the lobby has a well appointed waiting area with plenty of tourist information. Some of the rooms seem to have been redone with the change of ownership, and the bathrooms are all new white & glass. The rooms are very generously sized for New York City, and though the furnishings may not appear as new or glamorous as some other hotels, they are far from worn or tired. Some suites have small balconies, and some have views of the Empire State Building, so ask. If you have never been to the city, ask for a higher floor so the street noise isn't too bothersome. The most recent time I was there, the front desk staff was very helpful, and they even upgrade our room for free when they found out we had been there frequently and were traveling with people who had never been to the city before. My only complaint is that the beds are VERY firm, and after a few days sleeping on them my back starts to hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: olivernewwest
Reviews.Content: We loved the Bedford. Great price and very central. Staff was very accommodating and Domenicos restaurant was fabulous. We don't look for 4's or 5's, just central and clean - and it is! Updated bathroom was a treat. Grand Central Station 2 blocks away, a little wine store around the corner, Scotty's restaurant on Lex was fabulous and close - what more can you want!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Large Practical Room in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CheshireKats
Reviews.Content: The Bedford is just round the corner from Grand Central and as such is very accessible. eg. Buses to La Guardia, JFK, trains, buses and subway. We were able to walk to most of midtown Manhattan. The room is great for a city break, plenty of space and the kitchen area is very useful including a gas ring on which to boil a kettle. Could have done with an extra arm chair , an extra bedside table and chair for writing at the desk but maybe these had been removed to allow a third bed to be set up. We found the staff friendly and helpful. To find restaurants head to Lexington rather than towards 6th. We found a good little Italian just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: davina d
Reviews.Content: Had a delux studio 9th floor ,no view ,but clean and quiet .Fitted our needs great location and felt safe all you need when on a 6 day city break.Got a good deal from hotel so able to enjoy extra cocktails at grand central and to complete our break,allowed us to stay in room on day of departure . Would visit again

Reviews.Title: “Do not book the one bedroom suite.”
Reviews.Author: Shaw-Allan
Reviews.Content: We had booked the one bedroom suite, this had a double bedroom and a sofa bed. Unfortunately the sofa bed was very uncomfortable, the base offered no support and the springs were very evident in the mattress - we did complain after our first sleepless night and were assured that an alternative bed would be put into the room. This turned out to be a well worn single camp bed and as we are a family of four this meant that someone still had to sleep on the sofa bed. The room air conditioning was extraordinarily loud and therefore had to be switched off at night - when it was needed. The staff were not very friendly or overtly helpful and the hotel experience was not at all like our last trip to New York. On a more positive note, the location is good, the street outside fairly quiet and great diners, coffee shops etc doors away. New York is such an amazing place that you only tend to use the hotel to sleep in and as this was proving difficult it is hard to give it a positive review.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY-BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: ironworker2006
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here! seriously...i chosed it by its web site which was very catchy but when i arrived and asked to see the room before check in, i realized it was dirty, but i was completly shocked when i saw a small cocroach on the wall ...Yes on the bedroom wall...and off course i didnt check in...and advise you not to also...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LizDevon23
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews before we went we were a little apprehensive after booking this hotel, this was our first visit to New York so it isn't easy to pick a hotel when you don't know the area. The hotel was absolutely fine, the room was ready when we arrived (earlier than check in time) the bedroom & bathroom were both clean. It was in a perfect location for exploring New York and excellent value for money. There is a diner about a two minute walk from the hotel where you can get breakfast at a reasonable cost - just make sure you are hungry as they are huge breakfasts!!!. Would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills, mini-suites...”
Reviews.Author: b0nv0yage2007
Reviews.Content: I was so happy when our cab stopped in front of an old brownstone building that epitomized New York City. This 3-star hotel on E. 40th is in the heart of Manhattan and was priced extremely well considering where we were...I think we paid $235/night for a 1-bedroom with a micro-kitchenette. The room had not one frill, but - most importantly - had room for us (which included myself, husband, and 2 kids) to breathe with one bedroom, TWO fold-out couches, TWO televisions, and the micro kitchenette. Our view out the back window...the Empire State Building. A great deal...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jacquiWigan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of the tour advisor and it was worth every penny we paid. We had decided to visit New York for our 27th wedding anniversary, i had emailed the hotel in advance and on arrival the reception was fully aware that we were celebrating our anniversary and upgraded us straight away. We had a fabulous large lounge area,a king size on suite bedroom and a kitchenette. The room was far beyond our expectations especially having read a few negative comments on the hotel before we left. The hotel is within walking distance of several iconic locations, with Grand Central and the Chrysler Building just a couple of blocks away. Times Square is about a 5/10min stroll. We had a busy time while we were there but didn't have time to see/visit everything we wanted to so will be definately going back. I have recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues as in my opinion it has all you need.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Hiiri
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, my reservation was not listed as a â€šsmoking roomâ€™, although I had sent an email the week before to re-confirm. I was immediately assigned a smoking room, the down-side was that it had 2 queen-sized beds. Canâ€™t have it all, I guess. The concierge was very friendly and apologized for the mistake â€“ so no hard feelings ! The bedroom was normal size by New York standards, with a large living room (has an extra pull-out couch) and the bathroom was of sufficient size. There were two walk-in closets and a kitchenette. The rooms and the bathroom were clean, the air conditioners a bit dated, as is the â€˜decorâ€™. All in all good value for the prize and a very central location (bus from Newark stops 2 blocks away). 40th Street can be noisy late into the night and early in the morning, but there are not many â€˜quiet hotel roomsâ€™ to be found in New York and nobody expects that.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Lethally
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12.30am from @ LA; the night manager was gruff and seemed angry at us because he thought we were a 'no show'. We booked through a travel agent and didn't even think about advising them of our arrival time. It was not a good start. We went to our room which was basic but clean with a nice modern bathroom. Our neighbours were very loud and woke us very early (not soundproofed at all). The housekeeper was lovely. The location was good, close to restaurants, Grand Central Station, etc. The bellman was helpful with regards to ordering a meal in. It would be helpful to have some details in the room about meals/laundry etc. We didn't have much to do with any other staff so honestly can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagocoy
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay here. Front desk staff was friendly. There was a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator in room and there was free wireless Internet. That is about all I can say nice about hotel. Room was typical small NY room with uncomfortable bed with an old comforter I think they got from my Grandmother, smaller old TV, old windows so you could hear all of the street noises. Worst night sleep I have had in years at any hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Did exactly what it said on the tin!!”
Reviews.Author: jono_cfc
Reviews.Content: Bedford hotel for what we paid was a perfect hotel for a city break to NY. Myself and the girlfriend stayed for 5 nights in Jan 2008. The hotel staff were plesent and the room was spacious and very clean. We even had a small balcony and could look up at the Empire State from our room window, it really was magical. The hotel is idealy situated just off park avenue and one block from Grand Central Station where you can find the most incredible market place underneeth. I could talk all day about NY but if you are going then you have probably already planned your whole trip, but if you are looking for a centrally located reasonable and friendly hotel in NY then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “The Bedford Hotel was a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Buffy83
Reviews.Content: I pre-paid my hotel stay and arrived at the hotel to find out that the hotel had no reservation in its system for me. Even though I had a printed receipt with my payment information the concierge still refused to give me a room or even send me to a sister hotel. While waiting in the lobby to try to book yet another hotel despite my pre-payment the concierge proceeded to yell and scream at another group that asked how long their wait for their room would take. The group had been at the hotel for over 4 hours waiting for their room to be ready and the concierge informed them that they would receive a room by midnight. He then proceeded to yell at them that for all intents and purposes he was the manager and owner of the hotel that evening because there was no one else available to speak with. He yelled extremely loudly at this group for a solid 20 minutes. It was probably one of the worst scenes that I have ever witnessed and the worst customer service that I have ever received/viewed. I would not go to this hotel if you paid me to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Hotel Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MarianMcCartan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Bedford in Dec for a few days to do Christmas shopping sadly we had to cut short our holiday due to a sudden death at home .The staff were wonderfull they could not do enough for us well above and beond their duty and also returned the money paid for the room .I would highly recomend The Bedford besides the wonderful care they showed us the rooms were very large and spotless clean and the staff were warm and friendly and made their guests feel really welcome .

Reviews.Title: “Dated, But In A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SMiles87
Reviews.Content: I can't really comment on the hotel price, because it was an inclusive cost for a uni trip (flights, coach, insurance, and hotel)...but this was the second time I have stayed here (by fluke, both on college and uni trips), and it was exactly the same both times. Entrance and check-in area is beautiful, with marbled walls and floors. Lifts feel a little rickety, and can take an AGE to get to you, because it's used a lot, and there are quite a few floors. The rooms were being worked on when I stayed in 2007 (I think they do it floor-by-floor), and both times I have obviously stayed in a non-refurbished room. The carpets are pretty worn, and the electrics are SO dodgy. My friends and I all kept getting static shocks. We charged up from the carpets! I chose NOT to use the little kitchenette, because I didn't trust the cleanliness of the cups and bowls etc...and didn't want to cause a fire when trying to boil the kettle (which, again, not sure how clean the kettle was). That said, I did utilise the fridge- I bought some fruit so I wasn't purely living on take-out, diner, and restaurant food. Bathroom small, dated, and didn't feel 100% clean. Bedroom was okay, but the sheets/blankets were pretty worn. Same goes for the sofa beds in the living area. There was a satisfactory TV in the room too, by the way... Just around the corner was a great diner, called Scotties, which was great for breakfast - great pancakes, waffles, bacon and eggs! Also, it's definitely worth Googling "Comfort Diner", which is a short walk away, but worth it to set you up for the day. Mmmmm...! It's a no-frills hotel, in a really convenient location. Friends of 4/5 could share the cost of a room (thanks to the sofa beds).

Reviews.Title: “Truthful review”
Reviews.Author: DevonGunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bedford for Xmas 2009 with 2 teenagers (19 and 15) - Room 1002. Excellent location - 5/10 minutes from most sights but in quieter street. Only needed to get subway once to visit Statue of Liberty and ground zero. Good size rooms, beds large and comfortable, plenty of hot water, very warm rooms with air conditioning to cool it! TV and safe. Bit noisy at night sometimes (but you are in New York) so take earplugs if light sleeper - didn't worry my teenagers though! Small kitchenette with hob, fridge, sink, kettle, coffee maker, saucepans - no microwave which was advertised but no problem for us. One hob wasn't working and was fixed immediately Rooms need updating - clean but old fashioned and blankets tatty. Beds made (new mattresses being delivered whilst we were there), towels changed and room cleaned daily. Staff - one lovely concierge (don't know his name but he was small with mustache and speaks fast!), Jimmy was quite friendly, reception staff OK but not overly friendly or helpful but we didn't go to talk to them! Scotties diner (round corner) the best for breakfast - great pancakes, waffles, bacon and eggs over lite! approx Â£25 for great breakfast for 4 that lasts you all day. Also great pizza takeaway place round corner. Went to Ellen's Stardust diner where waiters sing all night, Heartland Brewery (below Empire State) and Ess-a-bagel (Cinnamon Raisin with berry berry cream cheese - delicious). Radio City music hall show great (South Sea Port ticket booth good for cheap tickets). Overall you get what you pay for - no frills basic hotel - will definitely be returning to New York and would not hesitate to stay at Bedford again. Tip - if travelling from Newark to City - get Newark Airport Express coach, $25 return and there is a $5 dollar voucher in magazine on airplane. Stops right round corner from hotel (East 41st Street) but make sure you leave plenty of time for your return journey. ENJOY - NYC IS AMAZING!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Service”
Reviews.Author: mvergare
Reviews.Content: My transportation was cancelled due to the snow storm two weeks ago. I called the hotel and the front desk told me my cancellation would be honored. I've now been waiting for 2 weeks to hear from anyone at the hotel. The manager and reservationist have ignored my voicemails which I left at the instruction of the desk manager. I'll never deal with these people again and plan to dispute charges. Way to take advantage of people Hotel Bedford!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for service, room, and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: Denise062
Reviews.Content: I was there on a little pre-trip for going with my 16-year-old daughter to a Student Leadership University Trip. We were very pleased with everything about the hotel from the price, room, service, and wonderful location. We will definitely stay at the Bedford again anytime we have a chance to visit NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Staff left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: paulette90
Reviews.Content: First the good news: 1. Great location You can walk to the theatre district, which saves on cabs and there is a great breakfast type restaurant around the corner. 2. Dominico's, Is a great restaurant attached to the hotel (I don't think the hotel has ANYTHING to do with the restaurant and only shares a common door. The reason I believe this is because the restaurant staff are very friendly and we would actually return to the restaurant. Lorra, the bartender, was spectacular. Sit at the bar and prepare to be entertained. She has been at the restaurant 9 years and the owners should give her a big fat raise! Now the bad news: 1. Front Staff LAZY 2. Concierge LAZY 3. Rest of Staff LAZY The staff are lazy and unfriendly. At the end of a shift we witnessed the lady behind the desk and her boyfriend, who was waiting for her, walk to the elevator, and start groping. I'm sure they were going upstairs to use one of the vacant rooms. Now, you may ask why l even cared about this. Well if she had focused more on the hotel guests and less on her boyfriend, our experience would have been a whole lot better. You may also ask why we didn't complain to the manager, who the heck WAS the manager? Housekeeping was very lax, our coffee maker remained uncleaned even though l left money on the pillow as an initiative to do a thorough job. Would I return to the Bedford Hotel? Not in this lifetime. Would l return to the Bedford if they overhauled their staff? Absolutely! Do they care if l come back? No. But l feel a whole lot better writing this review. Thank you Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at the Bedford Hotel, NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: WikedK
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible (very brief) stay at the Bedford hotel - we arrived, dropped off our bags, saw some sights and returned to the worst experience ever. We had loud neighboring guests whose sounds were not buffered by the very thin walls of the hotel. We had dried urine stains on our comforter (very disgusting). We had another guest walk right into our room while my husband and I were relaxing (in our undergarments none the less) before dinner. I was absolutely scared and freaked out after having someone either use a key card or simply walk into our room. I am certain our door was closed because I had checked it while figuring out what was going on with the loud noises coming from the rooms and hallways. We immediately packed up and went to the front desk. We talked with a manager who did NOTHING! He said hardly any words and was not concerned at all that we were leaving and upset over somone walking in our room. Had we not been there and the wrong person walked in, all of our belongings could have been stolen (everything doesn't fit in the room safe). And another thing, while going through the lobby we overheard another guest whose luggage was given to the wrong person and it was completely gone. They appeared to be helping her, but regardless they gave her luggage to another guest or stranger and not to the rightful owner. Shady operatoin all around. And I love small boutique hotels, but NOT the Bedford... terrible. Don't do it. Stay at the Fairfield Inn down near Times Square... it was reasonable and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: DevonWeeds
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comfy bed, coffee making facility, fridge and a 2 ringed hob so we could eat in if so desired, close to sights of the city The Chrysler and Grand Cetral Station being just around the corner, helpful staff, if you need help then Jimmys your man. A safe deposit box, a real asset to have one in your wak in closet. Yes we would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vidir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in a Tower Suite, 1 bedroom apartment. Overall very spaciuos but rather small bathroom. Old but very well functioning funiture, king size bed in bedroom and two sofabeds in the sittingroom/livingroom. Large LCD TV in the livingroom and a smaller one in the bedroom. Kitchenette with a small fridge and microwave. Should be better equipped, I had to go down to the lobby to open a bottle of wine as there was no bottle opener, only basics as forks and knives, dishes and glasses/cups. The wireless intetnet was very slow and I got a very bad signal from the hotel's routers. Could be limited to this room only. Great location, only five minutes from the Grand Central, good Irish Pub, Diner and Deli just minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value + Location”
Reviews.Author: LaurenV
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for a long weekend to visit some friends. Normally I stay with them, but they already had guests and easyclicktravel.com was offering a really great price. The location was the best part about the hotel - 2 short blocks from grand central station. The hotel itself was 'boutique' in style, but the rooms were much larger than most NYC rooms I am use to. I docked points for service and cleanliness - no big issues, just average. FREE internet! it was a bit spotty in the room, but great in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A rare bargain in Manhattan lodgings; excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MattyOSanDiego
Reviews.Content: You probably won't like the Bedford if you're used to 4 & 5 star lodgings, and expect everything to be new, perfect, and with all the amenities. However, bargain hunters should be very happy here. Our room was spacious, relatively clean, and fine for our needs. Plus, a view of the Empire State Building. The carpets and furnishings were a bit worn, but the bathroom tile and fixtures were new. Overall I found the hotel cozy and charming. And the elevators were super fast and smoothe. We had 4 adults sharing a "One Bedroom Suite" which had a King bed plus two fold-outs in the living room, plus a tiny kitchenette (really only a fridge, stove-top, and sink). The only downside was the bath was off the bedroom, so no privacy. Good for a small family or very close friends. But the price made it well worth it. I was a little leary about staying right by Grand Central, with all the noise and traffic. The double pane windows kept the noise to a minimum (hey, all of the city is noisy). And we actually enjoyed the neighborhood: lots of good small eateries (delis, diners, Indian Thai, Cuban, Japanese) and shops. I highly recommend Scotty's diner around the corner for a great, large, inexpensive breakfast. There are other parts of town that are much more crowded & difficult to even walk down the sidewalk. With Grand Central so close, get an unlimited Metrocard and you can get all around the city quickly, easily and cheaply. This is a fantastic location. I would stay here again without hesitation. The service was excellent. I had a couple of small problems which were resolved right away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Would Use Again!”
Reviews.Author: suzrWales
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 night stay in what I would describe as a huge room, 2 of us 2 double beds & loads of space to swing a cat! We were in 1702 on top floor, room had windows on 3 sides & a view from one room looked down towards the East River, location was great, everything touristy within walking distance. Booked directly with the hotel & got a good deal which basically meant we had 3 nights for the price of 4, could not beat their price on any of the hotel booking sites, so well worth checking out the hotel site first imo.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: HolfordUk
Reviews.Content: We must have stayed in a different hotel. It was awful. Noisy, dirty smelly room, carpet and decoration needed a good clean. Staff were abrupt and distracted. Would never stay here again. Location was OK though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: zeragu
Reviews.Content: Room clean and very confortable.Excellent position: only five minutes by foot from central station and less than fifteen minutes from time square.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas shopping spree”
Reviews.Author: ste1721
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful hotel in an excellent location in central Manhatten, highly recommend for budget breaks, xmas shopping in heart of New York and everything in between. Very nice family Italian resturant close to hotel aswell

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in the 'centre' of New York then this is the place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: McTravells
Reviews.Content: We received good service and advice from the front desk staff in the hotel, the room was excellent with a view of the Empire State Building to die for! Very spacious, cleaned daily and with small kitchen facilities including microwave / coffee perculator, kettle and cutlery. When showering we found that it often took around ten minutes to get hot water but a great little bathroom for two and worth the wait! The location of the hotel is brilliant! Just 2 minutes from Grand Central Station (Subway System) and by far the fastest, cheapest & easiest mode of transportation throughout Manhatton, get yourself a 'Metrocard' day or week pass from the stations vending machines or ticket desks and enjoy the colour coded tracks to all areas of M.Hatton. The city is very safe, just try to avoid the subways from around 2am. till 5am....just in case. We walked absolutely miles each day & night and never encountered any hostility from anyone, in fact we received loads of help and friendly advice from all the locals we spoke to on the streets and in the shops and bars, on foot is the best way to soak up the atmosphere of the city allowing you discover some fantastic street entertainment and cool shops. Hungry? then leave the hotel, turn right and 30yds. or so on the corner (East 40th & Lexington) is a restaurant called 'Blooms', great breakfast and reasonably priced, or if you want 'cheap & cheerful' 24hrs a day then try 'Scotties' on the next corner (East 39th & Lexington). The Empire State Building and The Rockefeller Centre are only a ten min. stroll away and are only two of over 55 attractions you can access for free with a New York City Pass ( see www.newyorkpass.com for details & prices) it's well worth the fee and you can queue jump with it too! If you like bargain designer label shopping then try the 'Century 21' store near the World Trade Centre, or if in 'Little Italy' you MUST try the Grotta Azzurra Ristorante on 177 Mulberry St. (aka. 387 Broome St. or check out www.bluegrotta.com) where we had the best meal ever, definately one of the highlights of our trip. Overall we just loved the hotels location and would recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, clean base for exploring the best 'happening' city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy-style boutique hotel in Mid-Town Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Grace-Heno
Reviews.Content: Location: Perfect spot in mid-town Manhattan, just two blocks from Grand Central Station (which is handy cos it only costs only $15 per person on bus from JFK Airport!) or flat rate taxi fare excl. tips costs $45.... ).,,, journey time is approx. 40 mins) The Room: We booked a deluxe twin-room directly with the hotel, but upon arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival!! No reasons given, no questions asked....loads of room with sitting room, kitchenette, spacious bedroom, bathroom, two wardrobes, safe etc). Hotel: Very relaxed atmosphere, very accommodating staff at front desk, are always willing to offer help and advice on best sub-way stops, shows, locations etc! We never had time to try the Italian restaurant next door but it looked liked it had a good vibe! Eating Out: There are numerous cafes and deli outlets nearby to choose from for breakfast and early lunchtime.....I would recommend the great selection of food outlets located at basement level at Grand Central Station....again just two mins from the hotel!! Grand Central even has an Oyster Bar.....all tastes are catered for.....later in the evening chedk out Campbell''s Apartment on the upper level to escape from it all and enjoy a cocktail or two in a chilled-out and relaxaing atmosphere.,,,before heading Downtown! Night-life: Hotel is in mid-town Manhattan, and there are a number of bars nearby, but get taxi downtown to Greenwich Village or Soho or Meatpacking District, if you're looking for late bars! On a final note: Check out www.foodsofny.com for the New York City Food/Cultural Walking Tours!!! These are three-hour food/.culture trails of best parts of New York - from Chinatown, Grennwich Village, Soho to Chelsea/Meatpacking District! For shopping: You're in the middle of it all!!! But for something different, head to Soho, either by taxi or take the 6 subway to Bleecker Street.....a stone's throw!! Enjoy the NY experience!! And what better way to discover NY than mid-town at the Bedford!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Conorgs1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bedford on a School trip with a group of around about 30. We came from England and after a long flight, wanted no hastle putting our bags in our rooms and going checking out the city. We got given our keys straight away and the lifts took us to our rooms, and they were perfect. Kitchen area, bathroom, two televisions with channels. The rooms were cleaned daily and clean towells, bedsheets were provided. The staff were friendly, and enjoyed a good laugh and always had a smile on there faces. There are some reviews on here which I feel are quite frankly, far from what I experience. For the price we payed, this hotel is great. With a nice diner next door for you to enjoy a breakfast, and a footlocker round the corner. It was great location wise. For New York, the room was incredibly large. Thanks for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: Travellers13
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel if you want friendly helpful staff, an excellent location) within easy reach of all the main attractions, and a safe area to stay in. We had lots of friendly advise from the Reception girls in particular and we were made to feel very welcome. The Italian restaurant next door is excellent. The hotel is suitable for all ages and is within easy reach of great bars, restaurants and Grand Central is only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Joanne35
Reviews.Content: The service we experienced was very good during the stay here. The hotel is very close to Grand Central Station so ideally placed for visiting other areas of New York. We got to stay in a suite near the top of the hotel so we had our room and a large dining/sitting area with a good view over Manhattan. The rooms were not ultra modern but were clean. We would recommend this hotel for a stay in New York. There was no restaurant in the hotel but there are plenty of places to eat nearby so you will hardly notice!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Kazza_Doll
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days from April 16th to the 26th 2009 and we got treated like royalty as soon as we walked in, they loved our scottish accent! haha! We got checked in straight away and they helped us in with the luggage to the 11th floor! When we walked in to the room, I was surprised as it was very spacious and to make the whole holiday, we had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building from our window...............phenomenal! The bathroom was brand new and the shower was amazing! Clean towels every single morning (and we were there for 10 nights) and they clean sheets on the bed every day aswell! Well wot can I say about the location, top notch I think! We were right next to Grand Central Station, and so central to everything. 5-10 mins walk to Time Sqaure which is nothing and we were so close to the Chrysler Building aswell! We had the time of our life in NYC and I would defo recommend this hotel to anyone. Before we went we read a couple of reviews and they were okay, but not great, so we were expecting it to be quite bad, and I THINK IT WAS BRILLIANT! We are coming back next year aswell to the same hotel, and we told the staff and they said they look forward to it! One word....................AMAZING

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DWDonegal
Reviews.Content: We were a family group,ie parents and three children aged 16 and twins aged eleven. When we booked in January for six nights we requested two suites beside or adjacent to each other ie on the same floor. However when we checked in at 3.45pm we were informed that the only rooms available were one on the 7th floor and one on the 12th floor, that nothing else was possible as the hotel was full. We reluctantly accepted this as accomodation had been paid in full in advance and we were informed that the next morning we could have two rooms on the same floor. We were allocated two rooms on the same floor the next morning but neither had a double bed as requested in our original booking. Rather than have to move again we settled for this as we had a lot planned to do in New York and didn't want to waste time packing and unpacking again.Apart from this hassle we were very satisfied. We had booked with an agency, maybe if we had booked directly with the hotel we wouldn't have had this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go! the staff is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: hdromano
Reviews.Content: the best thing is the hotel is its location. The hotel is old, the staff is horrible they are rude, regular, with all the passengers share this view. They never responded to anything. There are many choices to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but somewhat run down”
Reviews.Author: SmallDane
Reviews.Content: I went to New York together with my 17 year old daugther for a girls' winter break. I chose the Hotel on the basis of price, location and the TA reviews of which some were disappointed, some quite happy. First the good news: The location is first rate. Five minutes from Grand Central and in walking distance from Central Park, Empire State Building, Times Square. And quiet (by N.Y. standards!)! Breakfast is included in the form of vouchers for a (large!) continental breakfast, including fresh orange juice and coffee ad lib, to a very nice diner two doors down. There is a small kitchenette (a cupboard, really) with a fridge, coffeemaker and plates and cutlery, so that you can eat in (which we did twice). There is a very nice italian restaurant next to the hotel. The bathroom has all amenities and is suppplied every day with sumptuous towels and bath accessories (even conditioner and body lotion). The shower was hot (so no fear of legionella!) Beds are good, good mattresses, nice pillows and sheets. The room had a free WiFi, safe, ironing board, trouser press and hairdryer. Now to the drawbacks: The room was clean, but not overly so. It really needed a thorough renovation, but apparently they are doing the hotel up floor by floor, at least there were lots of carpenters and painters in the elevator always. The cold water had a peculiar smell, so we did not drink it (we brushed our theeth in it though, and none of us got sick). The heating seemed to be controlled from outside the room, as the very old radiator was very hot during the day and cold in the morning. We sometimes had to open the windows (which was difficult) to get some cold air into the room. We did not complain about it though. The staff was kind enough when approached, but seemed generally a bit disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SparkintheDark
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bedford was the base for my colleagues and I during a recent business trip to New York City. The location is great, just a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and Blooms Diner across the street is a great place to go for breakfast. The room was a mini suite, with separate bed and living room with a TV in each. The bathroom was small but the shower great. The living area had tea/coffee making facilities and a small refridgerator and microwave. Reception staff were very pleasant and our check in/out was prompt. Only drawback was that when we checked out, we were on an evening flight and so left our luggage with the hotel. It was all tagged up and we were given reclaim tickets, but when we returned in the late afternoon the bags were all sat there in exactly the same position and clearly had been sat there all day - not exactly the height of security.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: BeltwayBrian
Reviews.Content: Only two blocks from Grand Central Station, very reasonably priced. A baby crib was promptly delivered to our room on request. The bathtub was awesome, and the hotel's soaps & shampoos are very nice. We will certainly be staying at the Bedford again!

Reviews.Title: “A decent option in NY”
Reviews.Author: Doogie4868
Reviews.Content: The lobby is small but nicely decorated. The staff upon check in was having a bit of an argument with another couple that were guests. The manager(?) was a little more blunt with them then I would expect but in the end resolved the dispute in a manner favorable to the guests. The staff was great with us. Every request met with a smile and prompt action. The hallway on our floor was narrow, what one might expect from an old NYC building. The room was smaller than most standard hotels but again, old NYC building and wasn't cramped. The room was clean and had a fridge (a bit more room in it than most hotel fridges), a microwave, and coffee maker. Nice bathroom and roomy closet. The bed was very hard. Not a real good quality mattress. However, it was not unsleepable. The rates for this hotel are lower than typical NYC hotels, especially in the area this hotel is located in. This hotel is located in a very safe area of the city and nearby many points of interest. Overall, a great value in NYC with adequate to above average accommodations. We are from NJ, were in the city for a Holiday Party and decided to make a romantic night of it in the city. This hotel worked great to do that. We will definitely stay here again for the same reason.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for location/price”
Reviews.Author: dctreehugger
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a week before my stay on Kayak for a very reasonable price (for New York). The room was clean, reasonably sized (for New York), and the lobby staff were pleasant. The king-sized bed was super firm, although the sheets were somewhat lower quality than I'm used to in hotels of this category. The room also had a fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker, although I didn't use any of them. The only thing that was a bit of a problem was the noise from outside. Even though it was winter, I had to turn the A/C fan on to drown out the noise of all the sirens and horns honking on the street below. I only stayed for one night, so this wasn't a huge issue, but if you are staying for longer and don't plan to be up all night partying on the town, you may try finding out if one side of the building is quiter than another. (For what it's worth, I was in room 1210).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, ok accommodations”
Reviews.Author: hadley72
Reviews.Content: Rented a 1 bdrm suite w/king bed - excellent size. Hide-a-bed was outdated and uncomfortable to sit on as a couch. Not enough pillows (only 3) and NO wash cloths. Staff were accommodating with the requests for extras, but I hated having to continue calling. Room was adequately clean, but needs sprucing (painting, coffee table looked like someone took a bite out of the corner, etc.). Excellent water pressure which is a must in a hotel for us. Didn't like having no control over heat, but could open windows and plug in and turn on window a/c units which was a plus. Kitchenette could have been much improved by the additions of a microwave and dish soap (so we could have washed our own dishes), but still nice to have it at all. Having a small table and chairs in room instead of the desk or the stuffed chair would add a lot more...didn't like eating a meal on the coffee table. All staff were very friendly and accommodating. When we arrived in our room it had a queen bed and when I called the front desk they promptly moved us to a room with a king with no problem. This is not a fabulous hotel, but with the location and the price I gave it 4 stars because you can't beat the value. (We paid $255 the week before Christmas which for a one bedroom suite in midtown is unheard of!) Really enjoyed the location...very close to everything but just enough off the main drag. The Thai restaurant around the corner (Red Curry) on Lexington was cheap and had decent Thai food (and they deliver if you want). The deli /restaurant on the corner of 40th and Lex had decent, reasonably priced food for the neighborhood and very friendly staff. Oh, and one of the best slices of REAL cheesecake I've ever had. Only two blocks to Grand Central was a big plus. The deal with the parking garage was $24 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers07
Reviews.Content: My self and a group of friends stayed in the hotel over November/December. We stayed in 2 suites which were roomy & comfortable, it wasnt the Hilton, but we didnt pay Hilton prices! What a great hotel!! Its very central to EVERYTHING, the staff were very helpful & friendly to the point of as soon as we arrived in our room a maintainance guy came to to check a leaking heater, it had leaked on the floor and told us he would get us another suite without us asking for one!! They also have people to hoover lampshades!! Quality!! There was a hot pipe runing through the bathroom but its high enough for little people not to touch it and bigger people to realise what it is! I would definatley reccomend this hotel!! If i ever come back i will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: Auntie033
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel end Nov/early Dec 2008 for 5 nights. The room was fine - a bit old but clean all the same. The bathroom, again was really old with quaint old fittings in it, but again very clean. Although there was a really hot pipe running from floor to ceiling behind the door, with no warnings on - it might be a bit risky if you had children. There was a safe in the wardrobe which was a bonus. There was no microwave in the kitchen area - but all we used in here was the fridge anyway - it was great to have. This hotel advertises itself as having complimentary wireless internet. The service on this was terrible, it dropped the connection constantly. I even resorted to trying it out in the hallway one day, but it was just as bad. In my opinion, even if they have to charge for it, they should upgrade to a much better service. The location was excellent, only about 5 streets across from the start of Times Sq and a 15 minute walk from Macy's. One of the days I heard a guest say to the bellman "You people are all so grumpy today, did you all get out of the wrong side of the bed" To be honest, I thought they were like that every day!!! They were helpful, just not particularly friendly. We never ate at the hotel. We did get take-out one night from the diner on the corner - menu was in the room - and it was fine. There was also a lovely cosy little lounge by reception with a nice Christmas Tree!

Reviews.Title: “Old and Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: mm1234556
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the Hotel Bedford. I had booked my reservation on the website and the price was 245.00 per night. I did not keep a copy of the confirmation. My stupidity. When I arrived they did not have a record of the price of my reservation and I ended up paying 435.00 a night for a suite and for the price I paid, it was terrible. The light was flickering when we entered the room that looked like it had not been renovated since the 1800's. We had two pull out twin beds and one of the beds headboards was down by the floor on one side with a thin mattress that had poles you could feel the whole night long. The bathroom needed to be painted and the window was open without a screen. I also found a hair on my spread and my friend found a hair on her flat sheet. This is only the beginning.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: RandGP
Reviews.Content: Picked this Hotel based on cost and previous reviews. We was not disappointed. The location is ideal being only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and in easy walking distance of many of main attractions. Clean throughout, towels changed daily, staff helpful, good size room but bathroom dated and in need of decoartion - but hey it was clean and acceptable. Didn't have a view but what do you want for your money - we were out most of the day & night. Nice to be able to open windows and get some fresh air. Summary - a good well positioned hotel at attractive rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Palamino2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May this year for a week. Got a taxi from the airport but not a yellow one unfortunately - agreed a price but had to pay a toll on the way. The hotel was near Grand central - which was really handy. I would recommend this hotel - it was clean and tidy - no frills - but as far as I am concerned we are out all day - what more do you want. We could walk to Times Sq, Empire state and most of the sites, we got the metro to Statue of Liberty & Ground Zero. We caught a bus back to the airport - it was situated just round the corner - across the road from Grand Central - it worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bama08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Close to Grand Central, so you can go anywhere. Wine & liquor store and convenience store out front door go right and half block on Lexington. Hotel staff was very nice. Room was great, not fancy, but nice. I suggest that you get your own taxi to the airport. The hotel called Mexicana Taxi for us and the girl tried to get us to pay for tolls that were included in the price. We never passed a toll on the way to the airport. She would not take my mother 2 blocks from US Air to Delta without a TEN DOLLAR ADD ON. Her van SMELLED terrible. BLACK ICE air freshener that will give you a bad headache in less than a New York minute. Stick with yellow cabs only!!!!!!! I would stay here again, but I get my own cab back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel - Ruined our night in NYC. Totally Unprofessional.”
Reviews.Author: ticex
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor I expected the Hotel Bedford to be an acceptable hotel and a suitable venue for my girlfriend and I to relax on our one and only night in NYC after a week of travel around the USA. I couldn't have made a worse choice! Despite the fact I had a confirmed reservation guaranteed with my credit card I arrived at the hotel around 10pm only to be told by a rather agitated receptionist they had no record of my booking, everybody had already checked in and the hotel was now full. However, after 30 minutes of debating this it seemed a miracle had happened and some rooms might be possible but sadly at a yet to be disclosed higher price. At this point I was highly suspicious so I said "no problem, I'll go to another hotel" but before leaving I requested some kind of written confirmation from the reception I had tried to use my reservation and they wouldn't charge my credit card for a "no show". Funnily enough the chap at reception suddenly became rather aggressive and point blank refused to give me anything. The story now changed and he said he'd "do me a special favour" and give me a room reserved for a corporate client that was yet to arrive but I'd have to pay a much higher price - strange seeing as he told me on arrival everybody had already checked in. At this point I felt like I was being held to ransom so I refused his kind offer and said for me there were only 3 options: 1: I have my room as booked for the agreed price of "only" $295, 2: No room, so I have a written confirmation they won't charge me for a no show, or failing this 3: I'll ask the 2 police officers at the foot of the road to witness the situation so my card wouldn't be charged. At this point the chap at reception decided he would disappear to "the office" for almost an hour only to return with yet another offer for a room at a higher price. I repeated my list and said he had another 10 minutes before I had no option but to leave. Amazingly just before this deadline a room had suddenly freed itself up and my reservation was found. It certainly wasn't worth the trouble! Instead of the one double bed the room had 2 of the most uncomfortable single beds I've ever experienced, the TV was ancient and only showed one channel with so much interference it was unwatchable, the wallpaper was peeling from the corners of the walls, the toilet seat was an interesting shade of dark brown at the rear, the shower was dirty etc... Basically the room was run down and very badly cleaned. However, my 2 hour check in was obviously rather tiring for the reception as he had vanished so there was no possibility for complaints so I had no choice but to accept this awful room. Overall this experience essentially ruined our night in NYC and if the attitude of the receptionist and the bellboy are anything to go by I suspect is kind of the norm for late check-ins at this hotel. An absolute disgrace for a hotel in this price range and a complete waste of an otherwise good location. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bedford for the second time during the first week in September. Pleased that the room had been upgraded .I love this hotel despite its shortcomings which are: a) Lazy porters who wanted a tip but would not brave the torrential rain on the day we departed and my son and I had to put the cases in the taxis ourselves. Incidentally the taxi driver was no better: he would not leave his cab at JFK!! b) Dated decor of rooms though I am nitpicking. I love it because: a) The pub across the road-Dillonâ€™s Bar. Friendly staff and customers. Happy hour 5 days a week-no tips for the waitresses if you donâ€™t want to. Get served at the bar. b) Everything you need is nearby-newspapers, delis, chemists ok drugstores,Grand Central, buses etc c) Efficient and friendly reception. d) 2 large rooms, given that I always take my 2 sons who like and I like them to have their own room/beds. e) No noisy neighbours-you can hear the street but only just and anyway Iâ€™m always too tired after pounding the streets of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jrks
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was good, just two blocks from Grand Central Station. We had a beautiful, huge room that had a mini fridge, microwave, table and four chairs! Amazing for NYC! But, the problem was the bed - it was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept on. It was like sleeping on a squeaky box spring.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: So Ca, but wishing I was in the Caribbean!
Reviews.Title: “Offers what major hotels can't”
Reviews.Author: fromsoca23
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on some research, trip advisor reviews and the rates. We actually tried to find another hotel because some of the trip advisor reviews had us worried, especially since it was my wife's first trip to New York, I wanted her to have the best experience possible. I'm glad we couldn't find another hotel! As soon as we stepped in the lobby we were impressed with the atmosphere, it is an older hotel lobby, but clean and well kept. We booked a regular queen room but were upgraded to a suite on the 15th floor. The room was beautiful. Very clean, remodeled, still had that older 60's feel to it at the same time. I believe the 15th floor is the only one that has a little balcony you can step out on and look around. The balcony is not big, just big enough to sit down for a cup of coffee, but a great view of the Empire State builiding, and look around the corner and there was the Chrysler building too! The staff was very friendly and helpful whenever we had a question. The bedford is literally a couple minutes walk from Grand Central and about 15 minute walk from Times Square. The taxi cost about $28 from La Guardia ($5 Tunnel fee....customers have to pay bridge and tunnel fees.) When we checked about a bus, it was $12/ea. for the same ride. A taxi to Times Square was about $11. There is a Starbucks right across the street and a Dunkin Donuts just a few doors from there on Lexington. If you are looking for a nice place to eat, not fancy, just good food, with friendly staff....go to Scotty's around the corner. We hadn't eaten all day and got back from the night tour from the city (10:30pm) and failed to get something at Times Square. It's family owned and open 24hrs. The food was made to order, not re-heated, made right in front of you. Great little diner with the neighborhood feel, seemed pretty popular with the locals, half the people knew the owner. Not sure about Bloom's, but Scotty's was small neighborhood prices with big plates of food. GREAT hotel, best value, we will return when we go back to the city.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in august”
Reviews.Author: EST_DK
Reviews.Content: The decision to stay at Bedford was based on previous reviews. All in all whole experience depends on the rooms got. Me and my colleague stayed at Bedford for 3 nights in standard queen on the 11th floor. This floor was recently renovated and the room spacious. Still there were some downsides like the kitchenette part was out of date and reception was not eager to answer the phone. The location was really good and nearby 24h small food store was convenient. Also when traveling out of NY, we were able to leave our suitcases for the night with no extra cost. As we have stayed at different hotels we were pleasantly surprised that our room was actually occupied with complementary wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carinarod
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews in tripadvisor, I was confident that the Bedford was a really nice place to stay in NY. When we arrived the room wasn't ready and we had to wait while other people who arrived later would pass right in front of us to get their rooms. We got a room in the third floor which had absolutely no view, nor air conditioned (just a device that was supposed to cool the air but didnÂ´t work at all), the bathroom was very old and dirty and the safe wasnÂ´t working. The overall looks of the room was very old and filthy. The refrigerator and the microwave looked like they had been taken from a garbage can. Our pillows and sheets were not clean, and we even had to ask for them to be replaced on one occasion (you can confirm in the pictures). Even the TV didn't work very well: the image was terrible, and very few channels. No LCD nor plasma Tv like in other hotels I've stayed in. The room didn't have double windows and the walls were very thin, so during the night we could hear the cars going by and our floor neighbors arriving from their city tours. When they flushed the toilet next door, the water in our own toilet began to bubble!!! What a nightmare... One evening they even took my night gown by mistake and I had to ask for them for the return. This is not a 3 star hotel. It is even worse than some motels and bed and breakfasts that I've stayed in, and a bit pricey for what it's worth: I payed almost 900 Euros for a double room (5 nights). I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Bedford”
Reviews.Author: SteveEdmunds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bedford 27 to 30 Jul, 08. Fantastic little hotel in the heart of all the action in NYC. Euro style yes, but only as far as the lobby goes, but the one bed suites are simply huge. Plenty of space for a family of four, very comfy king size bed in separate room, two also quite comfy double size sofa beds in living room, and plenty of space to move around within room. Not so European then, as the tendency on the other side of the pond is for very small rooms. A good size fridge in room (not usual minibar size) for storing your own cold drinks (and beers!) and a small kitchenette area with stove, microwave, sink, coffee maker etc. Trouser press, iron, ironing board all in good working order. An AC that cools well, a must in NYC in the summer months! All in all, don't see the need to pay more (I paid 370USD per night inc taxes for this room, (its the third best in their 4 tier pricing of rooms) as after having checked out many many options, I couldnt find a bigger room with all these ameneties for under 600USD per night. Oh, and the icing on the cake must be the view of the Empire State Building, this if you are on or above the 12th Floor. Seemed to me the smaller rooms are from floor 2 to 10 or 11, the one bed suites from like 12 to 17 and the 'tower' suites above that. So, the higher you go, the more you pay!! Check out their website and you will get my gist. A great stay, a clean hotel and very friendly staff, and I would not waste my time surfing the web for other options if we go back to this wonderful city someday.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: ailzSligo
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel. The staff were so friendly and the girls at reception were more than helpful. 20 min walk to Times square. A block away from Grand Central Station. The room was lovely and had plenty of space. The only complaint I would have would be the air conditioning.....other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the heart of new york city. I would stay in this hotel again and will be telling my family and friends about it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: barney5California
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in New York City. The first time it was just my husband and myself and we stayed in a trendy boutique hotel on West 57th. It was very nice, but typically small according to New York City standards. This second trip our 2 adult children were travelling with us and after a lot of research I settled on the Bedford Hotel as it offered accomodations that would work with 4 adults without having to reserve 2 rooms, very costly in NYC. I was not disappointed! The living room (with 2 twin sleepers) was a very nice size and the bedroom with King size bed was also roomy and the bed was very comfortable! It is an older hotel but was clean and conveniently located within walking distance of Macy's, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station and many other tourist destinations. We were on the 10th floor and could go to sleep every night looking out the window at the lighted Empire State Building. Does it get any better than that?!?! We found the staff to be helpful without being intrusive. Our only 2 complaints were the first night there was very little hot water for showering but the situation was rectified the next morning and we had to request additional washcloths be left. All in all we found this establishment to be a great value and would definitely stay again should we return to New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Old, but cosy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: traveloldie
Reviews.Content: Instead of a studioroom we received upon arrival a suite with a separate sittingroom, a small kitchen area, a bedroom with two beds, and a very small but clean bathroom. This was very convenient and comfortabel to us, althoug the view was not very much appealing, the bedroom view was obstructed by a stonewall, but had a second (flatscreen) tv and was very quite. We had free internet in the room, a coffeemaker and a small, very slow cooking unit, a fridge, and some tableware. We feeled happy with it. The hotellobby is in fact much too small for the number of rooms, but we never used the lobby, while the hotel was close to many attractions, restaurants, deli's and Starbucks to sit down and rest, also very nearby a busstation and Central Station, it was very easy to go anywhere you like, for example to the ferry and cruiseboats, Times Square and within walking distance of Macy's. The service in the hotel is good, friendly and cooperative. If we go to NYC again, we will choose this old but cosy hotel again,because it is hard to find a similar decent priced hotel in this area, NYC is an very expensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_SWashington_UK
Reviews.Content: We have just spent four wonderful days in NYC. staying at the "Budget" Hotel Bedford. What a little gem this proved to be. We booked a "Standard" room through Trailfinders as it was our first visit to the USA. The room was more than adequate, spacious, clean, well appointed with a mini kitchen and a huge bed, room safe included and air conditioning that actually worked. The staff , although low key, were helpful and efficient and the location, just one block from the splendid Grand Central Station complex and about 25 metres from Lexington Avenue was excellent. The area is a haven of tranquillity yet only 10 mins walk from Empire State, Times Sq.and Maceys. We never felt anything but safe in NYC, no matter what the time of day and we were impressed how clean everything was, including the great value "Subway" system ($25 for 7 days unlimited travel). There are some good value places for eating in the neighborhood, notably Blooms (25metres)for breakfast and the little Blimpi sandwich place next door is great value. For a great Dinner try "El Pote Espaniol" on 2nd Ave East 38th st and Fagolioni just around the corner on Lexington Ave East 39 th st.. Both of these establishments are frequented mainly by local clientelle. Overall a splendid , good value hotel, no frills,but functional, clean and very efficient!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: hangus_8
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel we were made to feel very welcome by the staff giving us local information etc The hotel is situated near to the grand central station and ideal for most locations in mahattan. Room was very clean and tidy with decent facillities not that we spent much time in the room as i wouldn't imagine anybody would want to in this fantastic city. And just to round it off you have an excellent bar one block away which my new wife seemed to take a very good liking to!! Peter Dillons place give it a try great beer and spot on bar staff. Overall a very good hotel in an excellent location and i will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Bedford”
Reviews.Author: hotelgirl
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel so much I could live there ! Not surprising as this was an apartment building before it was a hotel, hence the great size rooms, very ample storage , the kitchenettes and ( joy of joys ) windows that open. This was my 2nd. time at this hotel, last year I was travelling solo but this time with a friend so booked a suit. Once again great room size and storage ( HUGE by most NY hotel standards.) The large lounge had its own storage ( containing digital safe for your valuables ) in addition to that in the bedroom, 2 double sofa beds and a decent size mirror so it was easy to work around only having one bathroom. For this reason though you may not want to go for max. possible room occupancy if it is an all girl trip ! Staff still as friendly and helpful as last time. Norman, (Mr. vacuum cleaner !) is a particulr favourite of mine. Yvette, our room service girl kept everything in tip top condition and anything we requested was dealt with immediately. Always plenty of hot water and fresh towels, although we did arrange that only the used towels ( left on the floor) be changed on a daily basis. As other postings have mentioned there are great food options on Lexington and at Grand Central, check out the food market on the lower level. If you are going to the upper west side visit Fairways supermarket on Broadway and 74th. street, this should be a tourist attraction in it's own right ! This is also the area to buy wine at a sensible price ( base of Brooklyn Bridge also good value). Two things worth knowing about the hotel is that they do have a washer and a dryer for guest use, located in the basement, and , if you need a brolly ( umbrella ) just ask to borrow one at the reception desk. I can't wait to stay at the Bedford again, for my next visit I will be treating myself to a Tower Suit with a balcony. I hope the above is helpful for anyone travelling to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: steveruthp
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Bedford for three nights in May. Although the hotel comes up on all the regular sites, we also had it recommended by a friend who lives in the US. Staff were friendly and helpful (albeit inaccurate when it came to the Times Square ticket office hours). The twin room had comfortable beds, and we didn't lack anything. The room was a reasonable size, especially by NY standards. We didn't use the kitchen area much (fridge/microwave etc) but what we used worked fine and was clean. As for the bathroom, it was a little dated and would have benefited from more thorough cleaning/re-grouting in places, although it didn't feel "dirty". The location was probably the best part. It's a couple of blocks away from 5th avenue, and easy walking distance to the Empire State Building, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center etc. Grand Central was just one block away, and a real architectural treat - it's also not a bad place for breakfast, although the coffee shop/bagel place next door to the hotel is fine for grabbing a something on the go. One comment about booking this - I'd searched literally for days for a good deal, and tried all the usual sites. I found Quikbook offered the best rates with no tie-in, so v easy to cancel had a better deal arisen. I kept checking other sites, and nothing better came up, so we stuck with it. I e-mailed the hotel and they confirmed the rates (inc tax) before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Dublin Girls "Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: MOLLY4902
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week stay in the bedford with me and my sister, well what can i say the hotel is just lovely and the staff could not do more for you, it's cheep and very clean and a fabulous location you cant really ask for any better really... if i was going 2 N.Y again i'll defo stay at the bedford hotel me and my sister loved it..... enjoy your hols shop shop shop ;0)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Once Again!”
Reviews.Author: mrslane
Reviews.Content: This trip we took kids instead of the usual all ladies trip. Everything was perfect! Even my Aunt was happy. The Bedford can't be beat for location and service. Bus services from the airports drop off at Grand Central which is just a few minutes walk away. I love the newly rennovated Tower Suites. My room allowed for a special night light - the glow of the Chrysler Building! We love eating breakfast two doors down at Blooms. The food court in Grand Central was a perfect spot to take the kids for dinner. Also located close by are ATMs, a drug store and a wine shop. The Bedford has nice, spacious refrigerators in the suites. We are already planning TWO return trips to NYC and of course this means staying at the Bedford. Both adults and kids agree!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShaneButler
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from New York and felt it necessary to write a review for The Bedford Hotel in Manhattan. I found this hotel on tripadvisor and I must say it ticks all the boxes. Value wise it was quite reasonable considering the location so I was a little apprehensive before we arrived. I need not have worries though, the location couldn't be better. It's literally on the corner of Lexington and 40th street, two blocks away from the Chrysler building and only a few minutes walk from 5th avenue. We rented a suite and it was huge. Fresh towels every day and it was spotless. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: belrich
Reviews.Content: Having done EXTENSIVE research & with the help,comments & advice of Trip Advisor members,we decided to book the Bedford for 4 nights. It was clean,warm & comfortable.Ideally situated with walking distances of 5 mins to Grand Central,15 mins to E.S.B. & 20 mins to Times Square.Excellent base location. Whilst showing slights signs of age,the bed & bath rooms could do with a little make up.Our room was on the third floor,inward facing with no "outside" noise at all. Being honest,negatives would be that the toilet flush wasnt repaired after being reported.The room safe didnt work even after we told that it would get sorted.Cups & dishes werent washed for a couple of days.The toilet roll wasnt replenished. These are review comments not complaints,as they didnt spoil or ruin the great time we had on our first & hopefully not our last trip to New York. Good value for money.Can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: BthereandCit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not all bad nor all good. The price was on the low side and that was what we were looking for and also being close to the subway and attractions. We could look out the window and see the Empire State Building. We also saved by using the kitchenette for a few meals. The room was larger than we expected. The king size bed was comfortable. There was plenty of closet space. The bathroom was fine. The desk and chair was really nice. The area was still noisy to us, vehicles/cab honking horns around the clock. Also we could hear the people in the ajoining room even crinkle their shopping bags. There was annowing yelling early in the morning two mornings. It took a while to get hot water running when you wanted it. Housekeeping did not seem repetitive as to the services given your room. We stayed several days and saw something different from housekeeping each day. The clerks were not very helpful in advising you on airport transportation. They want to sell you a $20 pp limo service. Some one at the station told us locals just take the subway and a local bus for about $4 pp. We did and it worked fine. The location was very nice since we found reasonably priced meals nearby and found walking easy to area attractions. We will shop around before staying again. We do know what to expect from the Bedford.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and good location!! But a COCKCROACH!!”
Reviews.Author: JessyRoo2
Reviews.Content: We spent ages looking for the cheapest but cleanest with good location hotel in NY and found this. We were delighted with the location, 10-15 mins walk from Times Sq past the cute Byrant Park, and the price was fairly good compared to what you can pay, after all we wanted was a bed and a private bathroom. We got the lowest priced double room, we had a direct view into some ones apartment about a metre away from our window, but we didnt care because all we did was sleep in the room. Staff were ok, didnt bother too much with them to be honest. Unfortunately one morning i went for a shower to find a cockcroach in the bath tub!!! I could have phoned reception but i knew my boyfriend would have moved hotels and it was too much hassle so i just gave it a WHACK with my boot. I was far more careful after that and put all our luggage on the chairs and didnt walk around without shoes. Saying that however i am about to book for new year in the same place, as the location and price is hard to beat. If you want to be nearer restaurants and clubs, bars go further downtown, we were a bit too far away

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Jo005
Reviews.Content: I stayed within this hotel over new year, i booked well in advance i.e 6 months before. When my friend and i arrived at the hotel our pre-booked room was not available! We had to stay in another room. Which was cheaper than the one we had paid for. During our stay an item was taken from our room which we had bought within the city. A full report had to be submitted to the hotel. The day we left we were told we would be contacted within 48 hours. It is now 6 weeks and i have still heard nothing. I have emailed several times regarding a refund for the wrong room and also a replacement item that went missing and the hotel have not had the common courtesy to reply!
