It seems that once they have taken your money they have no decency to contact the customer regarding outstanding issues! This put a real dampner on my trip, when i return to New York i will not be returning to the Bedford.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cosy!”
Reviews.Author: Annie_eile
Reviews.Content: Having researched extensively on the net for a good hotel, I went on the recommendations of Tripadviser and went with the Bedford - and we weren't disappointed. We called the hotel in person and asked for a renovated room and got room 1106 - a suite as there were 3 of us and it suited us perfectly. There was ample room, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was immaculate and it was toasty - too hot at times! The room was serviced every day although they slacked off on leaving shower gel etc after a few days! The porters were lovely but I found the reception staff gruff enough at times. There were a few delis, diners and a Starbucks in the neighbourhood, but we had to treck farther afield to find dining spots. That said, the location was great - a stone's throw from Grand Central and a few blocks from Times Square. Altogether, it was very comfortable, good value and in a fab location! Aine, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good with minor problems”
Reviews.Author: stevendrowe
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a very good stay and we were very happy with a) customer service, b) cleanliness, c) room size and facilities, d) location near Grand Central was perfect and a quiet-ish/safe area. Staff did go out of their way to assist us. What they could have done better/difficulties: a) people including ourselves were complaining about the heat in the hotel which was overwhelming. Staff said they couldn't do anything about it and advised us to open the windows. b) the kitchenette was a let down, much smaller than anticipated. We had booked a smaller room as well, for friends, and we didn't get what we asked for...we were hoping for a room with a microwave but got upgraded when we didn't want/ask for it...not a big issue really. c) guests luggage left in the reception was too much of a hazard and looked messy - they hotel need to consider a safer/tidier are for them. d) cleaning staff let themselves in our room without knocking on the door...luckily we aren't shy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Fairterms
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I travel we look for the very best deals possible. Going to NYC, I thought we'd be out of luck on bargain hotel. After extensive (seriously obsessive) research for hotel locations, amenities and prices I stumbled upon the Bedford Hotel. The decision to book the stay was nerve wracking but I did it anyway after reading some good reviews on TripAdvisor. What a relief it was when we arrived! The public transportation from LaGuardia really was simple. The hotel is 2 blocks from Grand Central so the location was perfect. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon so the normally busy business district was quiet but there was a fabulous street fair a block away. We ate our dinner at several different ethnic food vendors. The rest of our week was very busy and having a cool safe place to return to for rest was such a blessing. So, for the actual review...the staff were so attentive and helpful. The desk clerk loaned us his umbrella on a rainy day! The lobby was beautiful and clean. The elevator worked great (yipee!), halls were well lit and nicely furnished. Our room was very roomy. The furnishings were nice and new. The bathroom was clean and the view was incredible! My husband returned to NYC a few months later and booked his stay at the Bedford with no hesitation and with the same results.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: castleg
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance have just returned from New York having spent nearly a week there from the 10th to the 16th. I must say at times I was rather worried having read some of the reviews previously on TA in relation to this hotel, but I have to say the stay was absolutely great. OK the hotel rooms are slightly dated but in fairness the room we stayed in was clean and comfortable. Beds made everyday and the towels changed. The in room safe was invaluable. Really if I had one complaint it would be not publishing the call rates to phone from the in room phone. Got a bit stung on that for the first 3 days, but really that was our own fault and was quickly changed for the remainder of the holiday. The receptionist recommended going to the shop beside the hotel and picking up a call card. We got one for $5 which gave us 30 minutes to phone home for a hotel charge of 50 cent as a local call. There are many places to have a goos breakfast but we managed to have ours everyday in Blooms just down the corner. The breakfast filled us up everyday and the grub was good. The location of the hotel was brilliant. Grand central station was only 5 minutes walk away with access to the whole subway system. A car was arranged to take us to JFK airport on our last day which was on time and exactly the price agreed $54 incl. tolls. It was a great holiday for us and the hotel was perfect for us. We had a clean comfortable place to lay ou8r heads at night. Its not the Ritz or anything but it does what it says on the tin and I would have no problem recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: WindyCity_Koukla
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate, but NOT the room I paid for (they put me in a standard room but I paid for a studio). Asked at desk, clerk didn't seem to care. My room (501) was a dump. Microwave looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. Poor tv reception, someone had actually drawn on the chair in there, and noisy, noisy, noisy! Walked by another room down the hall that looked much better. I guess I just got stuck in the dump room. You can hear elevator "dinging" all night, steam heat is LOUD, water rushing through exposed pipes. But it was quite clean. Bed uncomfortable, closet had water damage to walls and smelled like something died in there. I cancelled my 3 day stay and moved to a much better hotel a few blocks away. But I would probably consider another stay, just NOT IN ROOM 501!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nessie55
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in October. the reception staff where friendly and let us into our rooms early with no extra charge. the room was clean and comfortable, the only downside was the view onto another building. the hotel is so well located, walking distance of grand central station and times square. it is also local for subway 6 that takes you to battery park for the satutue of liberty etc. we would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed.”
Reviews.Author: Einsfo
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive with the hotel, since it appears a little old and some comments here are rather negative. It was a very good surprise, though: 1 â€“ The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and had a beautiful view to the Empire State Building. 2 â€“ Excellent location. I can't stress this point enough! 3 â€“ We were four adults, and there was plenty of space. 4 â€“ Although staff is not very friendly, we were authorized to check in at 8 AM. No extra charges, no questions answered. 5 â€“ Prices were fair. Not cheap, not expensive. Do not expect a fancy hotel. This is not the kind of place you stay when you're traveling on business. It is definitely a tourism hotel, and for this purpose I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: halvgr
Reviews.Content: The Good: Although the furniture is a bit outdated the one thing the bedford has going for it is large, clean and comfortable rooms. The Bad: On the day we arrived from Italy, with 4 suitcases and 2 children in tow we were told that for the first nigt they had no rooms availible due to "unexpected renovations" We were told that they had booked us into their sister hotel for the 1st night. We were upgraded to a tower suite for the remaining 6 nights but we were given this only after we had told them that not having a room for us was unacceptible since we had booked 5 months before hand and confirmed our stay 1 month before arriving. Basically the upgrade was given only after we refused to leave and insisted that they give us a room there. Since we now had to move to another hotel we asked the doorman to find us a cab and after about 5 minutes with no success he just said "forget it" and went back into the hotel. The Ugly: On the day we checked out as we were standing outside trying to hail a cab a strong wind blew one of the Hotel's windows on the 3rd or 4th floor shut and broken glass came raining down onto the sidewalk a few feet away from me. As there was still some peices hanging off the window I alerted the doorman who proceeded to come out and check the damage and then went back in never to be heard or seen from again leaving broken glass all over the sidewalk. While I do like getting good value for money, ie big clean rooms at a fair price the poor service at the Bedford is enough to make me think twice before booking this hotel agian.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAD22
Reviews.Content: We found the Bedford Hotel to be very good, We stayed with our 2 children in a one bedroomed suite which was well equipped and spacious. We asked for a camp bed as there was a double sofa bed but the boys did not want to share. This was no problem and it was provided straight away. There was a safe microwave, fridge etc - all good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was alays clean. One tip - dont bother booking a car to the airport - the train is good and reliable. We found cab drivers to be not very helpful , very few spoke english and the driving was very erratic! On the whole this hotel is a great base to explore new york.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bedford”
Reviews.Author: step1052
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 4 night stay at this lovely hotel. 4 adults stayed in a large room which was very clean and above average facilities with fride, microwave, iron and two tvs. Maid service everyday ensured the cleanliness of the room. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and only to happy to offer their advice on where best to eat, shop, etc The hotel is in a great location very near to Grand Central and within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State, Madison Sq Gardens and Rockafella Centre. A most enjoyable stay in a lovely hotel in a wonderful city and one we will definately return to.

Reviews.Title: “always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: grainneireland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bedford for the last 3 yrs and I am going back again this year. We stay in a one bedroom suite which are really big which is great when you have about 10 suitcases between 4 women. The hotel staff have never been anything but friendly and would do anything to help you even look after 10 suitcases when we are going home so we can do the last minute shopping. I book directly with the hotel and Lidia is great anything you want to know you can just ring her. The hotel is in a great spot just 10 mins from Times Square and just around the corner from Grand Central Station. If you go in December which is the best time to go if you are Christmas fanatic which I am Bryant Park have great Chrismas stalls which sell everything there is also ice skating. Star Bucks is just across the road and there is a great diner on the corner. We always take a trip to Jersey Gardens to do our shopping its has every shop you could need plus its all indoors which is a bonus. If you are looking for a small quiet hotel in a great location Bedford hotel is perfect I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: trekkingkat
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a visit to New York and the surrounding area with my parents. When in New York City we stayed at the Bedford Hotel. It is in a great location in Midtown a couple of blocks from Grand Central. We walked to the Empire State Building, Macy's, Time Square and Fifth Avenue. We stayed in a 1 bed suite which was a nice size and the pull out bed was fine for a couple of nights. The kitchenette was very basic so when we wanted a coffee we took to popping out to the Starbucks on the corner is it was quicker to wait in line than wait for the kettle to boil. (Turn right out of the hotel and Starbucks is 30 secs down the road). They have a restaurant attached to the hotel which served some good food and if you don't want to walk too far on the opposite corner to Starbucks is a diner and just round the corner are a few deli's. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I am already planning to go back to the Bedford at some time in the future with my friends for a shopping trip!

Reviews.Title: “No problem with Bedford.”
Reviews.Author: WalesRubgy
Reviews.Content: Booked via OPODO (after reading several horror stories about them). Glad to say everything went smoothly. Flew with Continental Airlines and must say the flight and checkin in were smooth and easy. Changed our seat location at the check-in no problem and requested extra leg room (rows 15 and 16) at no extra cost, did this for the return trip at the same time. Arriving at Newark and got a yellow cab ($77) to the Hotel in midtown Manhatten. Hotel staff were very helpful, friendly and pleasant. Anything they could help with they did. The Hotel is in need of a re-fit but we didnt complain as it was clean and comfortable and we were only there to sleep, shower and change. We were a family of 4 (58, 57, 23 and 18) and had one bedroom (en-suite) and 2 fold up put-aways in the sitting room which were made up every day. We had a small kitchen where there was a cooker (didnt work, we never wanted to use it anyway). Some previous reviews complained about the small rooms although we felt it was ok for 4 of us. The location is as everyone else says 'ideal', it's just around the corner from Grand Central and is easy to get about from. Get the 7 day Metro ticket for the Subway and local bus's, it costs $24 (Â£12) each and you can use it as often as you like, we used it all the time to get around. We were originally apprehensive at first about travelling on the subway but must say we enjoyed the experience and never felt threatend at any time even though we did travel about up till about 11pm most nights. The only Taxi's we caught were from and to the airport, all other times we either walked or caught the subway. Lots of places to eat near the hotel. We had a great time and would go back to the Bedford as of it's location and near most of the main sites and Subways.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Damaskfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super location close to Grand Central Station. You can drag you suitcases from the airport bus stand and get to the hotel within minutes. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was small and a little tired looking, however, for the price and the previous reviews that was what we expected. It didn't matter to us as we were only in the room to sleep and since the bed was clean and comfy we were happy. The room had a microwave and a large fridge which might prove useful. There was lots of hot water, a decently sized bath and a good shower. Great place for breakfast at the end of the street. Additionally, it's worth going to the Pershing Restaurant (outside Grand Central)for at least one breakfast. We found this hotel to be good value for money and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel disappointing but good location”
Reviews.Author: Hunda
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights in June for mid July through Expedia as that was best price. We paid 107 pounds a night for a double and requested a non smoking room. We were shown into a room which stank of smoke on 3rd floor as they said there were no non-smoking rooms available. After complaining about the smell we were moved into another smoking room on same floor but did not smell. The room was not refurbished as Sheeyla from Northamptonshire got and our room was tiny, very old and worn, a fridge and microwave and coffee maker but certainly no kitchen. The bathroom was also tiny but adequate. The front desk staff were not especially friendly and the only good thing we can say is that is was a very good location. Will look for a better hotel for our next visit. Overall very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: The_Reisender
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bedford last week and would go back. The location is excellent; near Grand Central Station and within walkin distance of Times Square, Empire State, and Rockefeller Centre. The rooms, although not luxurious, were comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. At approximately $200 per night, for New York City, the Bedford was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rebel99
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed first stay to NY at the Bedford. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was older but clean. The location was really great. Loved being close to Grand Central Terminal. Walked to Macy's, ESB, and many other places.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unrefurbished rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the Bedford (around 9pm) we had fairly good impressions. We were booking two rooms and while the receptionist had no problems booking in the first room (#301), he said we had to wait for someone to come downstairs. Eventually, a couple come down and say "No, we don't like that room either," and hand back a set of keys for #310 before leaving the hotel altogether, luggage in tow and calls of "We still have to charge you for one night!" coming from the receptionist. Guess which room we got? Yep, 310. When we got into both 301 and 310 we were appalled - the rooms were old, dirty and smelly. Yes Mr Porter Man, feel free to turn on the a/c, but you're not going to hide the dingy mess you've led us to. We'd read on TripAdvisor that there were some refurbished rooms so we marched down to the lobby and complained, only to be told there was nothing they could do that night and to come back tomorrow. Eventually the porter came upstairs and sprayed each room with strong air freshener (only marginally better smelling), but this did nothing for the faded wallpaper and hole in #310's closet. The next morning we went downstairs and asked to be switched - surprisingly, the receptionist did it without questioning why. I can only surmise that they know what 301 and 310 is like. Our next rooms, 1101 and 1110, were much better. Functioning ACs, no bad smells, king beds, cleaner bathrooms and bigger TV combine to make a nice place to stay, while the fridge also has it's uses. Don't get me wrong, Bedford still has some downsides - the 'high speed internet access' borders on false advertising, the beds are hard and only my AC lets me specify a temperature, but compared to some rooms here 1101 and 1110 are wonderful. Our final comment - if you must stay here, stay only in refurbished rooms. Otherwise, head elsewhere. The fact the hotel is only one block away from Grand Central Station is good, but this can only make up for so much.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Bedford”
Reviews.Author: GeoffinUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an enjoyable stay at the Bedford. The hotel is very centrally situated midtown, just up the street from Grand Central Station and round the corner from the Chrysler building. We had a large newly-decorated room on the 17th floor, with a great view of the Empire State. Our window also gave us a grandstand view of the 4th July fireworks over the East River. The room had a small kitchenette, with refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker, so we were able to look after ourselves for breakfast. There was - mercifully - no minibar. There are plenty of restaurants, diners and steet-corner delis in the streets around. Just a couple of small minuses - the plumbing seemed to have an airlock in it, and produced frequent clunking noises. Secondly, the hotel seemed to attract school groups - three at separate times during our week. One particularly excitable group of girls managed to both jam the lift and set off the fire alarm (luckily we were out at the time). However,we would certainly consider returning

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: SueGloucester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bedford Hotel New York and were pleasantly surprised. It was very clean,staff friendly, and well located for all the sights - it could perhaps do with a little up-dating, however we would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for the $ in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: MGAL
Reviews.Content: Found Hotel Bedford on Hotels365 website while looking for affordable and conveniently located hotels near the theater district. Rooms were good size; not small, very clean and our room had a small efficiency unit built into the wall that was revealed by slider door. We had the option of making our own coffee/tea. An unexpected plus! Beds were very comfortable; and rooms tastefully decorated. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Checked our room to make sure all was in place and clean. How often does that happen?? Overall, very pleased with our choice at $275/night. I would recommend making reservations directly on the hotel's website; noticed rooms were same prices and some lower. Will definitely stay there again!!! M.G. Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: Fetlar13
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights with my wife and three children aged 17, 14 and 10. Plus Points. Great location, quiet street, but good bar near by. Easy walking distance of Times Square, Grand Central Station and 42nd St. Helpful staff. Highly recommend Sarge's Deli in 3rd Ave, between 36th and 37th Streets â€“ Excellent real NY deli, huge portions. Minus Points Hotel in need of a redecoration and some TLC. Arrived at 21:30 and found that we only had beds for four out of the five of us. Got some funny looks from the guy at the front desk when we told him we wanted to go straight to bed, until I pointed out that in England it was half past two in the morning and weâ€™d been travelling since seven (British time) the morning before. A fold up bed was found and delivered within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: redpetalsmile
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the bedford for 5 nights from 19th March and had a fantastic time. The location is excellent - it is in the Murray Hill area just around the corner from Grand Central Station for subway access and is within walking distance to many attractions in midtown. The room was nice â€“ two double beds a good size bathroom and a little kitchenette with a fridge, kettle and electric hob with saucepans, plates and cutlery etcâ€¦ The rooms were kept clean with a daily room service. One draw back was that I wanted a shower one afternoon but it appeared that they turn the hotwater off during the day (or it had run out ) - but I'm sure most people are enjoying New York in the day anyway and it was fine in the morning and evening. It also has its own Italian restaurant and blooms cafÃ© next door serves breakfast (we had breakfast there as it was included in our price as we had the winter package special). Nearby Scottys is also a good breakfast/lunch choice. They also allowed us to have a camp bed put up for $15 per night for a friend that was visiting for one night. Overall we had a good experience at the bedford - the hotel staff were very helpful and attentive and I would definately recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel ”
Reviews.Author: bec_toria87
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Bedford hotel as part of a college group of 50!!! The Bedford hotel accommodated us well, and the staff took real good care of us. The Bedford hotel was really nice to stop in, it was warm and very inviting. The hotel and its rooms were very pleasing, and kept clean and tidy at all times. There is also an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel where the food is beautiful, so if you like Italian then I recommend that you go! There were 4 of us sharing our hotel room and 2 in each double bed, but the rooms were very spacious and fitted us all in nice. The TV was quite big for in a hotel and had plenty of good channels, not that you'll be watching it much anyway! The rooms were cleaned daily and fresh towels and toiletries relaced, but check in draws and cupboards because the cleaners will put your stuff away! We were on floor 10 on the back of the building and had a wonderful view of the Empire State building, which looked amazing at night time. To top the hotel off were the wonderful staff who couldn't do enough to help you. They were really helpful and friendly, one even stood out in the rain to flag us down a taxi! The Bedford has a really good location and is close to a handful of famous locations. The 101 building across from the hotel was the building that was taken over by the Gremlins in Gremlins II The New Batch!! Times Square, Chrysler Building, 5th Ave, Empire state, Broadway, Grand Central Station and many more are within walking distance of the hotel. There also some really nice cafes and restaurants outside the hotel, and I recommend that you try Scottys for breakfast. If you love coffee then you'll appeciate the fact that there is a Starbucks cafe on every corner! The biggest advice I can give you is not to fly with any American Airline mainly DELTA!! We had 2 flights cancelled and had to sleep in a cold terminal at JFK, on the floor. They abandoned us and offered no help or compensation, we managed to get a flight home with Virgin Atlantic, but Delta would not release our baggage which remained in New York for 2 days after we had arrived home!!! Overall New York is a fantastic place, and the Bedford Hotel is deffinately worth a stay in.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: murns76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and staff were friendly and keen to assist. Our room view was very disappointing as our one window faced the fire escape of the next building! The location is great i thought. It 's about 300yards from the Chrysler building (which looks awesome at night!) and a short walk from grand central, times square etc New york is one of the best places i have ever been to so much to do your accommodation doesn't have to be amazing as you hardly spend any time in it! I would stay at the Bedford again as it was a nice friendly and clean hotel and the location was great. We landed at JFK which is about 1 hour drive to Manhatten but there is so much to see you don't really notice the time! I can't remember the exact temperature but it was hot and very humid, our skin certainly changed colour!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gay-Girlies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and found it satisfactory. Room was a little dilapidated but clean and warm, too warm in fact we had to sleep with windows wide open. Bathroom again could use some refurbishment but was clean with fresh towels daily. Staff very helpful and friendly. Hotel located right near Grand Central Station and on same block as drop off point for buses from Newark airport ($23 return trip) so good for getting around town. Blooms diner at bottom of street excellent for "big" breakfast and also bistro close to Grand Central Station good for fresh food. Did notice some rennovation going on at hotel (11th floor I think) so maybe they are working their way up? Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Poochpeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, 2006. This was our third time to stay in the Bedford. I cannot complain about anything. The accommodation is fine. I've read some reviews complaining about the standard of the rooms, but, so far, we have always been given really nice double bedrooms. Maybe we're lucky, but we have never had a problem with the plumbing. It's in a great location. Grand Central is just two blocks away. Blooms Deli on the corner is ok for breakfast only. However, this time we found an even better deli for breakfast just further down the street (towards 39th St). Sorry, but I can't remember the name.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but noisy, old and very dated”
Reviews.Author: athyme2fly
Reviews.Content: Upsides....very helpful staff, clean enough, convenient location. Downsides....very dated decor and furnishings, very hard bed, noise level was terrible (between the knocking radiator, the elevator and the doors slamming all night long, I don't think I slept for more than an hour at a time). The shower experience was probably the worst. The temperature would go back and forth from extreme cold to extreme hot. Won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k....”
Reviews.Author: AnneTralee
Reviews.Content: Three of us went to NY and stayed at the Bedford, recommended to us by an internet hotel company. As there were 3 of us, we booked a 'suite', which had a separate bedroom, with kitchenette as well. We thought this would be ideal. Like all other reviews, I have to also say that the location was excellent, although we did find ourselves 'raising our eyebrows' when we saw it all behind the scaffolding.. First impressions were not great! The lobby looked lovely, but the rooms really looked grotty, but then again, they were clean. I found the staff to be extremely nice and helpful. When we arrived, we found that the room configuration didn't suit us (double bed in the bedroom, and a double pull out couch in the sitting room - as we were 3 women, we each wanted our own beds), so they immediately changed us to a different suite which had 2 single beds in the bedroom, and the double pull out couch in the sitting room. The 'kitchen' is literally a sink behind a folding cuboard door, and has a fridge and coffee machine. It was fine. All we wanted really, was the fridge & coffee machine - we knew we wouldn't be cooking so this suited us. The bathroom was very small and very dated - the grout between the tiles falling out etc, but it was clean. Towels &sheets changed every day etc. The products weren't great, but being women this wasn't a problem as we brought our own. The one MAJOR downfall for us, was that the bathroom was off the bedroom, which meant that the person sleeping in the sitting room had to come into our bedroom in the middle of the night, which was really not the ideal situation. I was surprised to read in another review that they were able to order taxis to the hotel - They would not do this for us, and told us to go out on the street and hail one ourselves. When it was a different man behind reception, we asked would he do it, and again, he wouldn't. Because of this, and 'rush hour' we missed our dinner reservation, and for the other nights, we had to stand on the street a lot earlier to make sure we got there in time. They did however book an airport shuttle for us, which was very convenient. Also, they did allow us to keep the room until 3 p.m. on our day of departure which was very convenient for us. The first night as we were so jetlagged, we asked them to recommend a restaurant that was close. They did book us at the Italian restaurant around the corner, but I wouldn't recommend it. The food was nice, but minuscule portions and we were starving afterwards, devouring all the bread and fighting over the breadsticks! and the price was astronomical for what we had - we were studying the bill for ages just to make sure there were no mistakes! (It cost us $80 per person!!!!) Back to the hotel - No complaints really, except the bathroom situation, but if it's a central location you are looking for without paying a huge price, and if it's only for sleeping, this is the ideal place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away fron this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jet_Set_Addict
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, please do not stay at this hotel - I've just returned from NYC and had the misfortune to have stayed at The Bedford. Although the location was great, that's about all that can be said for it. When we checked in some other friends in our party immediately had to call the manager to their room as they found human excrement on one of the towels in their bathroom (I know, it's gross). Our room wasn't quite so bad - just exposed wires on the walls and a bathroom in which the bath was filthy, the hairdryer wasn't fixed to the wall properly and had wires hanging out at the back, and a sink that broke during our stay. Most of the staff we dealt with were very rude and unhelpful, to the point where it really affected our holiday. It's also worth noting that although the hotel has a restaurant and bar, for two nights of our four night stay we couldn't get in there, once because it was closed for a private party and hotel residents weren't allowed in, another night it just wasn't open, so don't depend on being able to use the hotel bar. Overall we were horribly disappointed with our stay, it was in no way worth the money we paid and I'd urge anyone NOT to stay there so they don't end up as disappointed and angry as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: hughesyuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained and as mentioned in other reviews the rooms decor was kind of old fashioned but who cares you're in New York and you only go back to your hotel to sleep so as long as its clean (and it was) then thats all that matters. We stayed in a standard room which had cooking facilities and tea/coffee making facilities. The hotel has a fantastic location situated approximately 5 minutes from Grand Central Station and about 15 minutes from the Empire State Building. Near the hotel there is an excellent little diner called Blooms on the corner where we had breakfast every day. We also tried the restaurant next door called Domenico's which was also nice. The locality is also excellent because it is quiet and seems to be more of a business area so the street outside is slightly quieter than average. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charliedog952
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hotel Bedford for our honeymoon because of the great location and previous reviews. We arrived at the hotel to find we had been upgraded to a suite room (1409). On entering the room we noticed that this was a good size room with a separate bedroom, bathroom and it's own cooking area complete with fridge and complementary coffee. The decor is slightly dated however the cleanliness of the room made up for this. Towels were changed every day and coffee topped up. The hotel does not have dining facilities however on exiting the hotel and turning right about 5 metres is an excellent Cafe called Blooms, which caters for breakfast and evening meals. On the other side of the road is a Starbucks. To get to the hotel from JFK Airport you can either get a taxi which costs $45 or take the Airport Shuttle Bus at a cost of $15 per person one way or $27 per person return. These tickets can be purchased at each terminal, the information desks will point you in the right direction. The buses go to Grand Central Terminal which is a 5 minute walk away from the Hotel Bedford.

Reviews.Title: “So Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: emaline123
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel/deal for Manhattan. This hotel is a hidden gem it seems in the sea of cruddy budget hotels in the city. It is labeled as a three star and you can truly find it for about the same price as the one and two stars in the area. The rooms were spacious and the view was great, right by the empire state building and the Chrysler building. The staff was friendly. The only complaint I would have would be that our bed was so firm, rock firm. But truly fantastic otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, air conditioning, TV didn't work properly, run down”
Reviews.Author: Dulciana-Maribella
Reviews.Content: The TV had wavy distortion, staff could only make it a little better, beds too soft, run down soiled uphostery, chipping paint, carpet was peeling up. Decided to try another room. The second room TV worked, but air conditioning fan did not stay on consistently although compressor was on. It was difficult to sleep because the room did not stay cool. The bathroom sink had two chrome legs in front and one of them kept falling off, if you barely touched it--since that leg was very close to the toilet it was hard to avoid. Again chipping paint, cracks on the bathroom door. The shower was good, the basics were clean, but it looked like it had not been upgraded for a long long time. Maybe other rooms were better from reading the reviews, but our experience was very disappointing and we are experienced travelers and have stayed in New York many times. It seems as if they are doing just the minimum maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: doodlebug1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in New York and stayed at the Bedford Hotel on E. 40th St in the Murray Hill section of NYC. The location was great, 2 blocks to Grand Central which made it easy to get around the city by subway. We had one of the newly renovated one bedroom suites (1604), it was great. They have done a very good job. The last few times we have been to NYC we stayed closer to Central Park and the only view you had was another building, not being surrounded by high-rise building this time the view from our room was good. We could see the Empire State bulding from two of our large windows . There are a variety of resturants in the area. It is only a few blocks to Bryant Park, an oasis in the city. We picked up some to-go and had a picnic in the park. The reservation process went well and Llidia was most helpful. Can't go wrong with the Bedford.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliBlk
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again. The staff are courteous and very helpful. Our room was quite large with lots of space, a little worn and tired maybe, but very clean. The "pantry" in the room suited us down to the ground. Maid service is spot on every morning. The location is excellent, right in the centre of things. From Newark airport, the airport shuttle bus drops people off in the next street from the hotel, so is within easy walking distance. All round a great hotel, maybe would not suit everyone, but it was fine for us. We had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel that I have stayed at in a long time......”
Reviews.Author: lozmow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 nights recently and I cannot emphasise enough how fantastic this place was. I was travelling with 2 other people and the tower room suite that I had booked was like a home away from home. The suite was like a small apartment with each of us been able to spread out. Been able to unpack your suitcase is a big deal when travelling! The kitchenette was also a godsend as we went to a local deli and stocked up on brekkie items and ate in every morning. Gives the digestive system (and wallet) a well earned break. The rooms were immaculate and we were fortunate to have room 1504 which had a balcony. What a novelty!!!!! I can also vouch for the airconditioning which worked overtime for us as we were there during the heatwave a couple of weeks ago. The staff were friendly and helpful and the guest laundry which is hard to find in Manhattan hotels, came in very handy. The location was great, within walking distance to practically everything. We caught a lot of cabs (when it got too hot to walk) and they are very affordable. We ate quite a bit at Blooms Cafe on the cnr of 40th & Lexington and Scotty's Diner on the cnr of 39th & Lexington. They gave you the biggest serves of food in Manhattan I reckon. There was a gourmet deli (cnr of lexington & 41st) which had a huge variety of food choices. If I had to complain about anything it would have to be the lifts in the hotel. They were very slow but nothing that would stop me from staying there in future. After my 9 nights there I am having trouble adjusting to the smaller hotels in the UK and Europe. Do yourself a favour and book into the Bedford Hotel. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kathym84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in the Bedford Hotel. The location is great, within walking distance of Times Square, Empire State and most of the attractions. Our room was on the 11th floor and was comfortable if not luxurious. The staff were helpful and friendly. Blooms cafe/bar a couple of doors down from the hotel does great breakfasts and lunches/dinners and the staff are very friendly. We would recommend taking the open top tour bus from Times Square to see the sights. You can buy your ticket in the Tourist Office in Times Square. The tour buses run every 15 minutes and you can "hop on and off as you please"

Reviews.Title: “Run-down rooms”
Reviews.Author: sgtraveller79
Reviews.Content: I would find the photos on the Hotel Bedford website quite different from how the rooms really looked. Was given a suite on the lower floors and was quite shocked by the condition of the room. The walls had cracks and cobwebs, the bathroom was old and run down. So were the sofa beds in the living area. Luckily we stayed only for a night. Don't think I will go back again. The price was quite cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonAL
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed in a Junior Suite in June 2006. Large living room with table, desk, Hi-speed internet, fold out sofa(pretty darn comfortable too) & TV, large bedroom with 2 closets & TV. Bath was just updated - fulll size tub with shower, pedistal sink and even an opening window...ahhh. In the entry hall area was a mini kitchen with frig, sink, micro and plates, glasses, silverware, coffee maker & coffee. There are plenty of min-marts around the block and we had breakfast in the room each day before we headed off as tourists. Great location, between Lexington Ave and Park Ave - just 1-1/2 blocks from Grand Central Station (great food court on lower level). Lots of eateries, drug store, bagels shops, you name it on Lexington within a block or two. About a 10-12 min walk to Time Square - a very safe feeling neighborhood for walking in the evenings.The best place we have stayed in NYC yet. The coolest part of our room was a balcony - actually a tiled ledge area with some chairs that only 3 rooms access. We could sit out in the evening and look at the Empire State Building (see my photos) and look down on apts having dinner on their roof tops. Really an added bonus - fresh air and excellent view! Dang I can't remember the room number but be sure and ask for the rooms with the deck. I booked thru the hotel and paid $275/night Friendly staff and pretty little lobby area with a couch and chairs, 2 elevators is a bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZSailfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights after a long haul trip. We were immediately upgraded to a suite. We have nothing but praise for the quality, location and service of this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: jonesyguy
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here based on tripadvisor reviews.Very pleased with all aspects of stay. Had the Queen studio and it was huge for the price. Clean,quiet room in great location to tour NYC. Safe and easy access to subways. Will stay here again. Only complaints are the room smelled of bacon as it was near the kitchen of a restaurant and the front desk was overworked and aloof.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: fix2a3
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at a Deluxe Studio on 5th floor for 5 nights mid-April. We flew in from Indonessia for a weeklong vacation in the New York area. We are extremely pleased with Hotel Bedford. Its location is great (2 blocks from Grand Central, 5 from Empire State Building, 15 minutes to Times Square). The room was spacious and clean. Everything worked fine during our 5 days: staff was friendly, the TV and internet worked perfectly. I booked via their homepage (--) and we paid $190 plus taxes. As far as New York goes, for a hotel this good and rooms this large and clean (and free internet!) this is a bargain. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Bedford, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: groovywilma
Reviews.Content: On a return visit to New York I decided to come back to the Beford Hotel after looking at many other hotels. There were 4 adults, so we booked a one bedroom suite. It was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel decor, furniture, and bathroom are a bit old and worn. We had a room on the 4th floor and had no problems with temperature or noise from outside our room. The small kitchenette was convenient. Walking to Times Square is a lot less stressful than taking a cab there. The free internet was helpful! The staff I encountered while visiting were friendly and helpful. I would come back to the Bedford Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Eileenandfriends
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at the Bedford for 4 nights from 29th April till 2nd May. On arrival the hotel staff were extremely busy and our room was not ready. We were asked to leave our bags and go across to the coffee shop(Starbucks) for 20 mins. When we returned the room was ready. It was on the 5th floor and was a one bedroom apartment with two single beds and a large lounge with two large sofa beds, no view. There was a small bathroom off the bedroom and two lockable closets with a safe, there was also a small kitchen area. It was very basic but clean. Renovations are going on and floors 7 & 8 are finished. We asked to be moved to floor 7 or 8 but there were no rooms like ours available on these floors so we were moved to floor 12. The room was identical to the one we had left so we lived out of our suitcases for a night for nothing!! The top floors are being renovated too and they are large suites with a balcony. Overall this hotel is in a great location. The airport bus drops you at Grand Central which is literally minutes away. You can walk to most attractions and shops or take the subway. The staff were always very friendly and helpful, day and night. It is a no frills hotel and smaller than you would expect for N.Y. Hopefully if you are staying you will get a nice renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellant location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights on our trip to New York. The hotel was excellantly located and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Our rooms decor was nice and didnt seem to be old at all. We were on the 7th floor, had no view but you dont spend much time there anyway. We had a fridge, kettle and a microwave. A lockable closet for all our shopping and a nice size bathroom, with lovely complimentary toiletries. As for breakfast, blooms diner is closed since the fire last year and Scotties diner is now also closed. We found a lovely diner on the corner of 39th and 3rd called Frontiers. If going back would definitely stay there and would recomend to anyone, looking for somewhere really nice to stay in New York on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my family (2 adults 2 youngsters). Not a fancy place but large and clean rooms with a staff that is very competent and friendly. With a location thats is excellent because it is close to Time square and at the same time at a quiet spot. And ofcourse with a good pricelevel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location (just one slight niggle!)”
Reviews.Author: philipo49
Reviews.Content: We recenty returned from a 4 night stay at the Bedford Hotel and were very impressed with the hotel and service we received. We had booked a suite (number 706)instead of a room and were very surprised at the size, it was huge! The suite was more than adequate with an iron and ironing board, hair dryer, mini kitchen with tea and coffee facilities and all the toiletries and towels you will ever need. Oh and there was also a plasma TV in the bedroom which was a nice surprise! The service at front desk was always friendly, the room was cleaned well and all the toiletries replaced everyday and the hotel itself was very nice. So why, you ask do I give it a 4 rating instead of a 5? Well there was one slight niggle about the room that I feel I should mention. Both the radiators in the suite had a habit of making a hell of a lot of noise during the night meaning we had to wear ear plugs to avoid constant wakings. And on top of this we couldnt control the temperature of them, leaving the room very warm all the time, so sleeping at night was uncomfortable without the window open. All in all we were impressed by the Bedford, and would definately stay again without hesitation, it's just a shame about those bloody radiators!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: lisacarew
Reviews.Content: SHORT AND SWEET--------loved this hotel and would definately stay again. Rooms very nice with useful kitchenette. great location. some nice eateries near by. try metrocafe. bagels fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Spinneyman
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews before our visit there was some apprehension before arriving. My wife, teenage son and I need not of worried, as our four night stay was all we could ask for given we were not paying high prices. The main benefit is its location. So near to many of the main attractions. Our room was one of the refurbished ones and as such delivered up to date everything, + space and cleanliness. The room was quiet (8th floor) and the service excellent. Would recommend this place to anyone wanting a reasonable place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay....”
Reviews.Author: yanomax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at this hotel on 2 Feb. and thought it was very nice...not like a Hilton or Marriott,it was much smaller and more ....well, not modern...but it was sweet in an old fashioned way. Really lovely lobby...we stayed on the 12th floor...went to NYC to visit our daughter who is going to college there. She decided at the last minute to join us for the night. We booked a one bed room, but there was room for a cot....and it was delivered with extra towels within 5 minutes of our request. I think we had to pay 10 or $12 dollars extra for the night for her too. There was only room for one cot tho if you need more room, you need to book a larger room. Great location. Very nice people who work there. Coffee in the room. Large closet. Comfortable bed...we were there in the cold winter...the room was warm. NYC magazines with all the city happenings and maps available also. Good location on the East Side...upper Murray Hill area. Lots of good resaurants and bars close by. Walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. I would agree with previous review as I was also put in room 205! Noisy and old. We were moved on second night and it was a lovely room, very roomy and comfortable. Staff were very helpful with directions, restaurant bookings and limo reservations. Previous comments about underground stations and bus connections are true, it was easy to get around town and we didn't take a single cab our whole trip. We had a great time and I would definitely use this value for money hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Bedford Hotel over the Christmas period. The location was perfect being just over a block to Grand Central station. The room was huge we had a family of four in there with plenty of space, having a small kitchen was great for a family. There was plenty of storage space. The sofa bed could do with replacing but everything else in the room was fine. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. I would certainly recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay there again if I was to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “great value at the bedford”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate for the weekend of December 10th-12th, and arrived early (before noon), expecting to leave luggage and check in later. Staff was very cordial. They had a room available and checked us in, giving our keys to the porter (you have to use him). It's new york, and he has to make a living too! Stayed in a "deluxe studio" for an annual girls' birthday/holiday weekend of shows, sightseeing and shopping with my sister-in-law. Initial impression: older, but very clean. By New York City standards (actually, any standards), the room was huge. No real view, but wasn't expecting one. I was expecting two twin beds, got two doubles. no microwave, but a "murphy-style kitchenette" with cooktop, mini frige, and dishes, utensils, pots, etc. Ridiculously immmense amount of closet space, including lock-up closet room with locking safe, but didn't use it. They "doubled up" on the toiletries. bathrooom was older ceramic tile, spotless, and there was plenty of hot water (pressure took a few minutes to "settle down", up on the 15th floor!). Hotel is on the corner of 40th and lexington, and a 1-1/2 block walk to grand central terminal for most subway lines, number six subway within a block on lexington. Lots of quick breakfast/lunch places around, and starbucks across the street. My hotel priorities consist of location and value, without compromising safety and cleanliness. This hotel fits the bill. Will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for....”
Reviews.Author: worldair
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a one bedroom suite at Thanksgiving. We were assigned one room and I complained. The room had carpet coming up and just looked worn. The second room was much better. The steam heat did not have thermostat control and was all on or off. We left it on and opened the windows. On Friday night the heat broke.I called the desk and they finally got things going again. The staff was friendly and tried to make everything work. It's an old hotel and needs a new lease on life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KAW13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my Husband we stayed from the 26th November for 6 nights. After reading some reviews on trip advisor i felt like cancelling our holiday. Those people who have booked this holiday and have not went yet dont get to worried on the reviews. If your looking to go to New York on Holiday you wont be going there to stay in your hotel all the time. Believe me you will only be in your hotel to sleep. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and it was basic. A bit dated but it was clean. The bed was comfortable and huge the suite was big. There are loads of cupboards to keep all your shoppong in. The location of this hotel is excellent you are near everything 5 mins to 5th avenue. and 10 mins to Times square. Two blocks away there is a park and there is an ice rink and little market shops were you can buy all kinds of stuff. It is open till late. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpfull and the doorman is allways there to help but dont forget to tipp him. When we arrived we were allocated are room which i asked for a high floor and no smoking but i was given a smoking room so i called down to reception and they sent up the doorman with a new room key from a room on a different floor this time it was no smoking there was nothing that was to much trouble for the staff. Here is a little tip for you for transfering from the airport to the hotel dont get a taxi they are anything from $40 to $70 if you go out of the airport main entrance ther is a coach they drop you off at your at different locations through manhatten it is $15 single or $27 return and they pick you up and take you back to the airport so you wont spend alot on your transfer you will have more money to spend when your shopping. The bus terminal is round the corner from this hotel about 2 mins walk. Well i hope everyone has a fantastic time in the big apple like we did. I will deffentley be back to The Bedford Hotel again i would strongly recomend this hotel. The only down side of it all is that you have to come home and come back to reality.

Reviews.Title: “great location, huge rooms and cheap but thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Anki77
Reviews.Content: First piece of advice - if you get room 205 immediately ask for another room. We stayed in 205 and it was a huge room but it was only one floor up facing the street. The windows don't block out much noise (but it is a quiet neighbourhood in the evening) however we were woken in the mornings at about 6am with garbage trucks etc. Also the room is right above the service entrance, so you get all the noise from that as well. Also we think the room was probably above the boiler room as it was roasting every night and you could hear the fans 24/7 although you got used to it if you could forget about it. Also the plumbing was a concern as we could hear the toilet bubbling away every now and then. We considered asking for another room but we got used to the noises in the end. Besides that, the room was big and clean and we only paid $170USD a night plus tax in the end. As we didn't spend much time in the room, it didn't really bother us too much and didn't ruin our time in nyc but i probably wouldn't stay there again. Whilst waiting at the elevator one day we did see into another room which looked heaps better than ours, so they probably all aren't as bad as ours. My recommendation would definately be to try and get a room at the back of the hotel and up a few floors.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one week with our seventeen year old daughter. We had a one bedroom suite which had a sofa bed and kitchenette in the lounge room and a huge and comfortable bed in the bedroom. The bathroom was old like the rest of the hotel but clean and functional. The shower had decent pressure and hot water at all times of day and night. September in NYC is hot and sticky so with three people looking for a minimum of two showers each per day this was crucial. Our room also had a lockable walk in cupboard which we were assured had only one key so security for our shopping was never an issue. All of the staff were pleasent and helpful at all times. Blooms deli, just four doors away is excellent for breakfast, we went every day. With Grand central just five minutes walk away the whole of manhattan is within easy reach. Fifth ave is just ten minutes away at a bewildered tourists pace. A midnight horse drawn carriage ride back from Times square to the hotel was just $45.00. The hotel is an excellent base for shopping and tourism not particularly cheap for a pretty basic hotel but then in NYC location is key and this place is right where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “three ladys in new york”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: two friends and i have just returned from new york. well what can i say but fantastic. we stayed at the bedford hotel in midtown. after reading some reviews we where a bit worried at what is was giong to be like, but it was great the staff were very pleasent and helpful. the room was very clean the maids came everyday and cleaned also changed the towels. the big advantage of these rooms are the kichenette only small but at least you can make a brew when you want not like most hotel rooms in new york which are room only. the view wasnt up to much as we where at the back but as we where only on the 7th floor we could just see the tip of the empire state building if you were higher up you would see more. the bathroom was very clean with a good powerful shower and nice and hot. just outside to the right is blooms a great place to eat for breakfast or dinner good portions and good price. we went on first day for breakfast & dinner but unfortunatly that night they had a fire (which was very exiting with about 12 fire engines and police just like in a film)i must say nobody was hurt as it was closed at time. so we then went round corner to scottys dinner which was just as good. the postion of hotel was great 5mins from 5th ave and empire state, 15mins from times sq also as we were three women on our own and new to new york we felt very safe even at night to walk down the nereby steets. to sum up we would have no hesitation to go back to the bedford and recomend it to anyone. new york is a fantastic place we had a fantastic time and didnt want to come home everyone was so pleasent to us and helpful cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rathcoole24
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at this hotel and found it perfect for our trip.It's close to all the main sites, shops and within minutes walk to plenty of bars & restaurants.We had the 1 bedroom suites which had double bed,convertible double sofa bed in the living room area & kitchenette.The staff where helpfull and nothing was too much trouble.As with a lot of New York hotels it's an Old hotel but has everything you want for trip to New York with out breaking the bank, which leaves money for the more important things !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were quite nervous after reading all the reviews but our six nights in this hotel were good. The room was big and both the double bed and pull-out bed were big and comfortable. The fridge was handy for water and juice. Some minor problems like hot/cold showers and broken room safe but not serious enough to cause any problems with our stay. The best thing about this hotel is location, location, location. If you are not a perfectionist then this hotel is suitable for staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Bedford Hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: Izzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Bedford, finding it about the only suite under $300 for 4 adults to stay in the area. We paid $270 a night which in many other cities (like ours, Atlanta) I would have considered a rip off but hey it was NY. The tiny hotel lobby is nice, however, it is not wheelchair friendly as there are a half dozen stairs leading down to hotel lobby and that is the only access. The staff were pleasant, our room was ready earlier than we expected. However we were given a room w/ two twins instead of a queen. We immediately called down and as they were booked we could not switch. I did not want to unpack everything for one night so we stayed in that room. But other than that the room was good, had good views of the Empire State Building and if you leaned over, you could also see the Chrysler building. Carpet felt/smelled clean, furniture looked sort of dated but wasn't worn. Room was huge, although bathroom was small. Tiny little galley "kitchen". No microwave. But the fridge was nice and we heated water and made coffee too, and they had plenty of mugs, plates, etc. The beds weren't that comfortable but they weren't the worst either. It was very very quiet at night (except occasional siren below on the street) and very dark as well. Everything was clean and functioning, except two things that bothered me were, 1. a big water spot on the ceiling (we were on the top floor), and 2. the shower - a little mildew on some tiles on the wall, and the water temperature varied wildly, you had to be careful not to get scalded. Also the windows opened fully - I don't know if that's common in NY but we were on the 17th floor and I would have been very nervous if we had young kids with us. No screens or anything. But all in all it was a decent stay. NY taxes are so high, I can't remember our final bill but it was definitely more than $270 a night b/c of taxes/fees that NYC levies. The location was pretty good, very close to Grand Central and the Chrysler building where we caught the subway, cabs were easy to get except for one morning, but it was rush hour. We ate at a nearby restaurant, Docks, which had good seafood and a nice atmosphere but was pretty pricey. I would recommend staying at the Bedford if you can't afford something nicer, it works for a family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... and that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maybe we were just unlucky, but our 3 night stay at The Bedford started badly, didn't improve much, and then ended terribly! Upon arrival, we were shown to our room, but when I opened the closet it was full of clothes! Luckily whoever's room it really belonged to wasn't taking a shower! Finally we were shown to our actual, very small room, which was OK. What next? Oh yes. I put our valuables in the room safe, but when I opened it again that evening the power failed which meant I was unable to lock it again. I was assured by reception that their 'engineer' would fix it as soon as possible. Needless to say, when we checked out 3 days later the safe still wasn't working and I had resorted to hiding our passports in more and more bizarre places! We were allowed to squeeze our valuables into a tiny safety deposit box in reception. But when the guy on reception took about 10 minutes and about 15 keys to get it open again, I decided I'd stick to hiding things around the room. What next? Again on our first night, every time my wife used her hair dryer, we lost all power in the room, which had me fumbling about trying to find the fuse box. Never mind, "let's go down to the hotel bar for a relaxing drink". Not quite. I know New Yorkers are famed for their 'attitude', but a guy behind the bar at the Bedford makes Danny DeVito's Louie De Palma character in Taxi seem like a nice pleasant chap! "Let's go to bed then and get a good night's sleep". Wrong again. BANG! THUD! BANG! Someone should introduce the Bedford to hydraulic door closers. You know, those things that gently close a door behind you. The Bedford's doors are like giant mouse traps. Crashing shut every time someone enters or leaves their room. And unluckily for us, we were next door to a gang of party boys. In and out all night! BANG! BANG! Surely nothing else could go wrong on our New York trip? Doh! Both of us got food poisoning! (At least we can't blame that on the Bedford!) So we had to stay in bed all day Saturday and booked a cab at reception for 4am on the Sunday to leave for the airport, paying a $12 deposit. We were assured that it was a 24 hour check out. When we appeared in reception that morning (still shaking and shivvering with the effects of food poisoning), surprise surprise, there was no receptionist. Just a porter fast asleep on a sofa. When we woke him to ask if we could check out, he said "Gimmee five more minutes!" and went back to sleep! After the initial shock (was this real, or just a food poisoning induced nightmare?!) we woke him again and he told us that the receptionist had gone to bed in one of the rooms but hadn't told him which one! So he spent the next five minutes shouting his name up the stairs! (4.10am. No sign of our cab at this point.) Eventually the receptionist appeared and called the cab company who said that the booking was actually made for 4PM! So we had to get our deposit back and stagger down the street with our cases and catch another cab, arriving at the airport late, sick and fed up. Oh yes, it wasn't until I'd recovered from my illness till I realised that I was charged over $70 above the agreed rate for our stay! Bye, bye Bedford. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for lads trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and three friends booked this for our four night trip to New York, and were assigned a one bedroom studio (two single beds and two foldaway beds in the living room). The room was decent, but not too grand with a tiny kitchen area behind a cupboard - useful for making drinks, storing drinks, breakfast etc... Plenty of closet space, small but clean bathroom. Quiet rooms in this hotel that is SO close to Grand Central Station - very convienient. Staff are friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Johno_TDi
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for the money. My travel agent made a mistake on my booking and booked a double instead of a twin room, and upon arrival they managed to change it promptly, even though they had to change alot about! staff are very helpful, rooms have aircon and kitchenette, including fridges. They allow you to leave your bags after check out, and use the lounge in the lobby. they even arranged our cab back at a cheaper rate (flagging down taxis is a mission) When i return to New York, I will use the bedford hotel without issue! John S.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience at our New York home”
Reviews.Author: GerryD609
Reviews.Content: We take our various grandchildren to New York- have done so four times. We have always stayed at the Bedford. It is CONVENIENT. The shuttle from Newark Intl (Liberty) stops a block away. It's two blocks from Grand Central and subway connections, including a Times Square shuttle. Within a block are, a convenience store with Dr. Pepper, an anytime diner, a great Jewish delicatessen (Bloom's), and a drugstore. The Bedford is not elegant but is comfortable, with a friendly staff. Our rooms had complete kitchenettes with pots and pans and tableware (you can doggie-bag it from Bloom's)! The hotel has a good Italiian restaurant, open spasmotically, and there is a nice, tiny, in-hotel bar (when we want a few minutes to ourselves). My wife lost an earring somewhere in the room, told the staff, and a week later she received it in the mail. My grandchildren (all girls), known to be picky, love it, and my wife and I do too. It's our New York home. From Texas

Reviews.Title: “Worked Out Great”
Reviews.Author: Peque
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a one-bedroom suite with a sleeper sofa between Aug. 31 and Sept. 4. Location was terrific (easily walked from Broadway and Times Square), very close to subway at Grand Central, and decent restaurants and stores all around. Best part: we stayed in Room 1501 which had a fairly large patio, where we looked up at the MetLife (formerly PanAm) building and a small piece of the top of the Chrysler Building. You could also look down 40th Street and see the East River into Queens. On the patio, we had morning coffee and wine in the evening. How many reasonably-priced rooms in Manhattan can give that kind of experience?! The room was a little quirky and slightly rough around the edges, but it was large, clean, and comfortable enough for three. For the price and location, we didn't care. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jenni67
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York with my son and I was a little hesitant about the hotel after reading some of the reviews on here. Anyway....the hotel lobby is very grand and plush, which is a little misleading as the room we stayed in was shabby in places: The bathroom was very old fashioned and the wall paper by the street window was peeling off. There was also piles of rumble/dirt tucked into corners by the window and snail shells tucked behind the air vent! Despite all this the beds were comfortable and the rest of the decor was fine. The hotel staff were quite freindly, although I must stress the porter was very unprofessional. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's central to almost everything yet tucked away in a quieter road away from the hustle and bustle. There is a diner on the corner called Blooms which serves fantstic food by really freindy staff. All in all this is a nice, quite, safe hotel. I would stay at the Bedford again primarly because of its position but next time be a bit more assertive and mention about the lack of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bedford for a week at the end of July. The reception staff were friendly, polite and helpful and there was no problem with my reservation, made through a discount website (I did contact the hotel separately to confirm my reservation and arrival time). The room was old but clean and comfortable. It had a certain charm although it didn't have a view. It was spacious by New York standards. The room - a studio room - had a microwave, coffee maker and fridge. High speed dial up internet access was freely available. The location is fantastic - only a block and a half to Grand Central, the subway and the Airport bus. It was centrally located for walking to many sites and attractions. Lots of dining and take out options near by and like another reviewer, I found Scotty's Diner (just around the corner in Lexington Ave) a good option for breakfast. I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Bedford”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bedford with a friend for six nights at the end of May including the Memorial Day weekend. We both found the hotel much better than we expected from some of the reviews. I agree that it is in need of renovation and redecoration but the room was large & clean. The beds were comfortable and there was always hot water for a bath - did not test the shower. Above all the staff were exceptionally nice and helpful. The safe in our room was broken which was a bit of a nuisance but we were offered an individual safe behind reception if we had wished. The location in midtown New York is excellent and there are handy places to eat and/or buy food. Bloom's do a good, but very large breakfast, and the 24-hour Deli on Lexington does whatever you want most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well placed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bedford for four nights over the memorial day weekend, and found it to be a fine hotel. Ok some of the fittings are a little past their prime, but the suite for 4 people was large and airy, and as we were on the 15th floor we had the added advantage of the balcony that had superb views of the Empire state building. The staff were helpfull and quite knowlegable. Superb position on 40th and Lexington, with a 5 minute walk to the Grand Central subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Bedlam at the Bedford”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - these guys could care less about you as a guest. I arrived at the Bedford at 9 pm. They told me they had no rooms available to honor my prepaid reservation due to water problems. OK, stuff happens, I understand. Then they sent me across town to a facility that would not even qualify as a youth hostel (a lobby sign proudly proclaimed that all rooms now had bathrooms) where the posted room rate was $100 - I had paid $175 through Orbitz for the Bedlam. Anyway, it didn't really matter because the new hotel didn't have rooms available either. They were oversold - but I was welcome to wait and maybe something could become available. While conversing with the clerk (through bullet proof glass normally seen only in bad neighborhood liquor stores), I overheard a poor British woman crying in the line next to me. She had travelled all day from England, and had waited 7 hours (so far) to get into her prepaid reserved room. I called the Bedford back but the man at the front desk said there was nothing else he could do. I travel almost every week, and have for over 30 years, but have never been left stranded in the middle of the night like this. NY was completely sold out. I had wander door to door until someone finally took pity on me (for $600!). Reserve at the Bedford only at your own considerable risk.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay at the Bedford”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bedford with my husband, son, and five-year-old granddaughter on the nights of May 1 through May 5. Having read the mixed reviews of the place, I was more than a little apprehensive--comfortable hotel or just a dump? I'm happy to report that we were all pleased with this hotel. We were in a one-bedroom suite, which had a HUGE living room and smallish but adequate bedroom. The decor is fine; I was worried it would be depressing. There is plenty of drawer space and two large closets. The bathroom is acceptable and clean, but, as with the rooms, you can't hide the fact that this is an old hotel. We had no problems with water turning from scalding to cold, and there was plenty of water pressure. (My son said taking a shower was like having his body pressure-washed!) Don't expect much from the "Kitchen." The little refrigerator is fine, and it's nice to have the extra sink, but the two stovetop burners are VERY slow, and there is no microwave. Unlike another reviewer, I found the iron to be clean. Maid service was good, too; I made a point of leaving a tip each day. The safe, which sits in a closet that can be locked, is very small, and the hotel will only guarantee valuables if they are locked inside the safe. So I wouldn't recommend locking up your computer in the closet. The hotel now offers free Internet access, which we didn't use (having left our computers at home). Note that the charge for phone calls from the room is steep; your best bet is to buy an "800"-type phone card and use that instead. The one-bedroom suite has two phones but just one TV. Nonsmokers: Be sure to check with the hotel that you are indeed booked into a nonsmoking room. The hotel doesn't have many rooms of that type. Although there is absolutely no view, we liked being in the back of the hotel (room 506), where it's very quiet. The hotel's location is superb; it's just so accessible to everything. Finally, we were very happy with breakfast at the diner (Scotty 's) around the corner on Lexington; it's quite inexpensive and good, and kept us going for hours. There are all kinds of restaurants (in various price ranges) within walking distance, too.

Reviews.Title: “quite good actually”
Reviews.Author: eldrakyn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at quite short notice after a small problem with the booking at the Southgate (not the hotels fault, just the booking agent). Got a 1 bedroomed suite for around Â£100 a night and to be honest it wasn't at all bad. Although I was concerned as every site I went to about this place gave a different rating I found the hotel to be clean (maybe the windows could do with a quick wash, and the bathroom was a bit dated) and pleasant. The staff where great, especially the maid and the doorman (who managed to get us a cab to Newark for $60 all inc, and even offered to go around the corner and collect our takeaway). And it had quite simply the biggest bed I have ever seen. If you want a large room/suite quite cheap without any bells and whistles then go for the bedford. One thing to consider is the hotels location, it is a good walk to Times Square or the ESB One tip. the filter coffee in the room is foul, Duane Read sell the papers for the machine and starbucks will do the coffee grounds

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bedford for 6 nights from march 19 - 25.
