The location of the hotel is ideal on 40th street in Midtown, 5 minutes walk from Grand Central Station and 5th Avenue shopping. The hotel is situated on a calm and quite street, which is nice. We had a room with twin beds on the second floor. The room was large and had all the amenities we needed. The hotel is in some need of renovation, though the furniture and amenities seems to be new and of high standards. The bathroom was not modern, but was rather well-kept. The water in the shower had a tendency of shifting from hot to cold without notice, a "classic" feature in older hotels I guess... Towels were clean and changed every day. The cleaning of the room was very good. Overall, we were happy with this room and our stay at the Bedford Hotel. It is not a hotel you visit for the atmosphere, but the location and value for money are strong points to consider. We can recommend this hotel if you are on a limited budget (we payed about $150 a night for the room, no breakfast included).

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a bit scared of staying here after reading some of the reviews about this place. I found this hotel great value for money compared to similar hotels of this price. The rooms were really large, with huge beds and a TV. The bathrooms were a little small and could do with updating but were perfectly fine for just a few days. Found all staff very helpful and the hotel was in a fantastic location, couldnt have been better! Only slight problem was the noise of the pipes at night which were very loud but slept through most of it as exhausted from the busy days. Overall would definitley stay here again, its not the plaza but then you arent paying plaza prices. Great base for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a major facelift!”
Reviews.Author: rtbabb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bedford on Sat., 4/9/05 - just one night, thank goodness. I was with 4 girlfriends, so I slept on a cot that was like sleeping in a wire hammock. The room was clean, but very "tired". The bathroom was old, mildewed and exhaust fan-less (hence the mildew), and we wouldn't touch anything in the kitchenette - very grungy. Also, the pipes made A LOT of noise and it often sounded like the toilet was going to explode. It was easy to get scalded in the shower, as the water temperature changed radically whenever someone flushed elsewhere in the hotel. The iron needed to be cleaned and the ironing board was in bad shape. It was, however, VERY SPACIOUS and the staff members were friendly and helpful. If the owners would only renovate/update the Bedford, it would be a first class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the bedford hotel over the New Year in 2005 from the 27th December until the 6th January. The staff were very friendly but I had stopped in better hotels in the past. It didn't really matter though as i was hardly there, with all the shopping and sight seeing. I would PROBABLY go again but with different people and a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay i guess”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ive just got back from my stay at the bedford hotel. The location was great, about 10mins walk will take you to times square etc. Its based on a quiet road so you hardly hear any traffic noise ! The hotel rooms were nice, i stayed in a one bedroom suite which was great the four of us. Clean, lots of space and having a kitchenette included was very handy ! The reception staff at the hotel were pretty unhelpful and rude. Im not sure if i would come back to this hotel as we were not made feel welcome what so ever. But i cant say the same for the baggage staff that helped us to our room, they were very friendly and inviting !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me & my Mom stayed at the Bedford Hotel in Feb 2005 for 5 nights and we found the room very spacious, clean & charming. it was in the perfect location to everything and the staff were very friendly and helpful. they recommended places to eat which were lovely. I thought New York was fantastic and I will definately be coming back some time in the future. Unless I'm lucky enough to win the lottery and be able to pay to stay at the Waldorf Astoria, I would be happy to stay at the Bedford because I know that it is ideal and nice. I would recommend this hotel if you want to save your money for sight seeing & shopping. There is so much to see & do you literally only sleep in your room anyway. Bellunos (italian) and Peking Park (chinese) are just minutes away and we had lovely meals there. We found an irish bar called Mulligans near by and we had nice food there to, the bar staff were very welcoming. The pick up point for the bus to the airport is in the next street and is $12.00. We got a taxi to the hotel from the airport and it was $60.00 but had we got the bus it would have been $20.00 return. Just remember that you have to tip everyone there. It was one of my best holidays, Statue of Liberty & Central Park were great and the Empire State building was fantastic.
